For generations, witch doctors have tried to make a resurrection potion. Attempting a variety of herbs, insects, minerals and liquids to construct a potion to vitalize life. The result was called “NECTAR” .

The “NECTAR” refers to a hand card and element collection game allowing 2-4 players to play at the same time.

In the game, players play as witch doctors to construct a formula by utilizing all available resources to develop a potion in the sacrificial stage. The players who can formulate the most highly purified potion will win the game.

This is an unprecedented world of wonders, in which imagination and wisdom will become your catalyst.

The best part of the game is that you can mix different tools and materials from the fantasy world to produce unexpected results.

If you love imagining the world and would like to escape from the dull real life for a little while, or just want to have some fun with your family, friends and neighbors, the “NECTAR” is the best choice for you.

The fire is rising, while the witch doctor is formulating the valuable “NECTAR”.

At the start of the game, each player draws 6 cards. Players will place one card each from the deck into the sacrificial pot. Players then take turns, placing one to two cards from their hand on the board. When all the cards between two sacrificial pots satisfy the necessary condition, the collection of cards will be put into the discard pile and the player will gain one point. These conditions include:

1. A total of five basic kind of medical ingredients: toads, snails, spiders, mushrooms, and skulls.
2. Gather four of the same basic medical ingredients
3. Potency level or 11 or above

If the results conform to several scoring rules at the same time, an extra point will be awarded. Players can also use token and prop cards to change the situation in the game.
207670.name: NECTAR

207671.name: El Tigre: The Adventures of Manny Rivera
207671.description:
El Tigre: The Adventures of Manny Rivera is a video game based on the Nickelodeon television series of the same name, published by THQ. The DS version was developed by Barking Lizards and released on October 29, 2007. A PS2 version was developed by Blue Tongue and released on March 11, 2008. The PS2 game acts as a simple platformer over four levels and two bonus stages, the object of the game being to collect "macho points"
Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Tigre:_The_Adventures_of_Manny_Rivera_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

207672.name: Voldétour: 4 player expansion
207672.description: Two sets of playing pieces to make the game playable with 4 instead of 2 players

207673.name: Greek Cinema Quiz
207673.description: This is a quiz game regarding the Greek cinema. With this game you share beautiful moments with your friends by putting in test your memory and knowledge about famous greek old and modern movies. The game components: Board, 6 pawns, 484 cards, a die and the rules

207674.description:
User summary

This is the fifth extra Tragedy Set to Tragedy Looper, but it's numbered to be "2B", as it's in the same ideas as the second extra set: Horror.

This set is based around the Cthulhu Mythos, and contains everything needed for the tragedy set, including script creation guide and 6 sample scenarios.
207674.name: Tragedy Looper: Weird Mythology

207675.description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are spanners in the works which may help (or hinder) you.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
207675.name: Mauritius & Réunion (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

207676.name: ATS Gallabat: The War in East Africa 1940
207676.description:
Gallabat: The War in East Africa 1940 is a set of 10 historical scenarios taking place around the borderlands between Kenya and Eithiopia, pitting the forces of colonial Britain and Italy against each other in fierce, early-war battles.
Besides the 10 all-new scenarios there are four 11" × 16" geomorphic boards to play them on, as well as 368 color, die-cut counters including new soldier art; all the combat counters needed to play!
Ownership of the ATS Rulebook and standard system markers are required.

207677.name: ATS King Red + Operation Deadstick
207677.description:
This Advanced Tobruk System module contains maps & scenarios for two separate invasion points during the D-Day operations.

First, King Red, and the amphibious landing by Commonwealth forces at the eastern portion of Gold Beach, where the 5th Yorkshire were faced with Weapons Nest 33 (Wn33), a Nazi emplacement bristling with weaponry. This aspect of the game features modified Churchill and Sherman tanks, the "funnies", such as the anti-mine Crab variant and the emplacement-busting AVRE.

Second, Operation Deadstick was the codename for an operation by airborne glider troops of the British Army that took place on 6 June 1944 as part of the Normandy landings. The objective was to capture intact two road bridges in Normandy across the River Orne and the Caen Canal providing the only exit eastwards for British forces from their landing on Sword Beach. Intelligence reports said both bridges were heavily defended by the Germans and wired for demolition. Once captured, the bridges had to be held against any counter-attack until the assault force was relieved by commandos and infantry advancing from the British landing zone.

This set includes new scenarios, maps and all the combat counters needed to play out King Red and Operation Deadstick.
Ownership of the ATS Rulebook and standard system markers is required.

207678.name: The County Fair Game
207678.description: The objective of The County Fair Game is to have the most fun at the county fair by spending as much of your money to win prizes, be awarded ribbons, take photos, eat food and experience the fair. Players begin with 85 play dollars to spend at the fair. Before entering the fair, they must first find a parking place (roll to land in spaces around the outer edge of the board.) Upon entering the fair, players roll a die each turn and can choose which space to land on (usually from several options.) The player with the most points from accumulated prizes, and experiences wins.

207679.name: Torment: Tides of Numenera - The Explorer's Guide
207679.description:
[From the back of the book]

Explore new lands. Discover new creatures, unearth new secrets.

The Torment: Tides of Numenera computer game is set in a whole new region of the Ninth World. This book details the weird and fascinating places, people, and creatures first glimpsed in Torment. Discover secrets of the computer game, and explore its world in greater detail. Incorporate the region and its inhabitants and conflicts, in whole or part, into your campaign. Maybe even become a castoff or explore the Tides, mysterious forces that can shape human interactions.

Delve into Greater Garravia and the splendor of Torment: Tides of Numenera.

The book includes:
- Detailed descriptions and maps of prominent areas in the computer game, including Sagus Cliffs, the Bloom, and the Forge of the Night Sky, along with other points of interest in the region such as the Lost Sea, Tiaow Chain, and the Great Library.

- New character options such as the Bloomborn and Slick descriptors, the Breathes Shadow and Speaks With a Silver Tongue foci, and a new racial option: the aquatic Gibra from the water city of M'ra Jolios.

- New creatures, including the ever-hungry corpuscular maw, teh transdimensional crystalvore, and the golden nakal.

- Stats and details about important NPCs from the computer game who are ready to step into your campaign.

- Tips on playing a castoff, the same type of character you play in the computer game, along with optional rules for using the enigmatic forces known as the Tides.

207680.name: Russian Subway Dogs
videogamehonor: 2017 PAX Curse Award Editor’s Choice Winner
207680.description:
Every morning dozens of stray dogs make the commute by train from the Moscow suburbs to the downtown core in search of food and fortune.

You may have read about the clever strays of the Moscow subway system in the news, now you can experience a day in the life of one of these dogs! Russian Subway Dogs is a score attack arcade game where you play as a stray dog scavenging for food on the subway platforms of the Moscow metro. Sneak up behind unsuspecting commuters and scare up food or highly volatile vodka with a quick bark. Compete for sustenance against other subway wildlife including rival dogs, pigeons, and the rare and dangerous Subway Bear.

Source: The Developer Website.

207681.name: Rock Bandits
207681.description:
User Summary

An action platformer set in the world of Adventure Time. You play as Finn the Human (with the Jake the Dog) as you cross several regions of the world of Ooo attempting to free the audience from Marceline's rock concert who have been frozen and kidnapped bythe Ice King and his band.

207682.name: Das kleine Gespenst: Spuk auf Burg Eulenstein
207682.description: Every night in Das kleine Gespenst: Spuk auf Burg Eulenstein, the little ghost awakes at the witching hour to run through the castle rooms to play. Its favorite game is cannonball bowling — but where did it hide the cannonballs last time? Who can help the little ghosts find them again? Who has been paying attention to which chests hide which cannonballs?

207684.name: Incognito
207684.description:
User Summary

A mash up of different genres, this game takes a RPG style base and combines it with RTS when in a spaceship or liken to a tank military strategy game when on a planet's surface. The creators and publishers were Ron McDowell and Kyle Polulak.

207685.name: Les Manley in: Search for the King
207685.description:
User Summary

In this game you are a tech specalist for a company.

207686.name: Mille Bornes: Edition spéciale Sécurité Routière
207686.description:
Small version of the old french classic game given for free during 2016 summer holidays on french highways. This was for educate drivers on road safety.

Only 32 cards in this version:
16 mileage cards
4 dump hazard cards (1 classic - red light - and 3 specifics for this version: Alcohol, Phone call, no motorcycle equipment)
8 remedy hazard cards (green light, negative ethylotest, end the call, motorcycle equipment)
4 safety cards (emergency vehicle, SAM - the guy who drives don't drink, hands free kit, full equipment and airbag

Other changes from the usual rules of the game:
The goal is to reach 500 km
No need of a green light at first before playing mileage cards

207687.description:
A deplorable tabletop game devoid of joy, hope, or humor; which, regrettably, is also far more awesome than it has any right to be.

In Endangered Orphans, players take turns choosing to move around the board, playing options to either help their orphan survive, or make their opponent's orphan suffer.

When an orphan either runs out of options, or in an act of desperation, reveals the boogeyman, the boogeyman takes the orphan.

When all but one orphan are taken by the boogeyman, the game ends, and the last orphan to survive is the winner.
207687.name: Endangered Orphans of Condyle Cove
boardgamepodcastepisode: 17. Devon Dice podcast Room Escaping, Surfing, Murder, space surviving and Klask...

207689.name: Granny's Place
207689.description:
User Summary

As with the other Temple Software games, this is a simple text adventure, with most puzzles simply consisting of giving the right item to the right person.

207690.name: Les Manley in: Lost In L.A.
207690.description:
User Summary

Les Manley: Lost In L.A. is the sequel to Les Manley.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
207691.description:
Ambition and a thirst for wealth have driven humanity to strive for ever greater progress. In America, during the 19th century, battles were waged between huge railway corporations that sought to connect state to state and coast with coast… making themselves filthy rich in the process. Railroad Revolution drops you straight into the middle of these tempestuous years; a time that changed America forever.

In Railroad Revolution, you will manage your own railroad company, ruthlessly competing to be the most powerful railroad tycoon across all America. You will build railroads, establish stations in your connected cities, expand the network of telegraph lines, and chase your objectives, increasing the value of your company with every action you take.

You start with mainly a team of non-specialized workers, but during the game you can hire additional ones with specific skill sets. The cost or effect of an action is determined by the type of worker that does it. To complete your company objectives, you will have to remove some of your workers from your active pool, promoting them to managerial positions. You must carefully assign each of your workers to perform the right action at the right time in order to exploit their specializations in the best way. You need to decide which ones to promote and which are instead still needed to take actions, as your priorities will change from turn to turn.

Railroad Revolution is a fast paced game with relatively simple rules, and it provides you with interesting and challenging decisions. Having a good strategy and finding the correct timing to implement it, is the key to winning the game.
207691.name: Railroad Revolution
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 75 - Interview with Cephalofair Games Isaac Childres
Episode Four - Gloomhaven, Railroad Revolution, Unlock!
I postumi di Spiel 2016 – Il Dado Incantato #12
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 73 - Spiel ‘16 Treasure Hunt Part 3
THE GAME PIT: EPISODE 81 - PICKING OVER THE BONES
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 93!!

207692.name: 10 Tage durch die Schweiz
207692.description: Imagine a 10-day trip through Switzerland. During your journey you visit the cantons and lakes that have a common border. You eventually will have to ride a train, bus or a seaplane to connect two destinations. With a little luck, you will draw a card that is perfect for your trip. In the end, 10 regions and means of transport must be aligned in the right order, Simple rules that guarantee fun and entertainment for children and adults.

207693.name: Withering Kingdom: Flurry Of Arrows
207693.description:
User Summary

Withering Kingdom: Flurry Of Arrows is a fast paced action - fantasy role playing game made by R. Romine.

207694.name: Paddle Up
207694.description:
User Summary

Paddle Up is a VR pinball game that you can practice your table tennis skills and compete against other players and robots.

207695.name: Sanguine Sacrament
207695.description:
From the introduction:

For the first time in eons, ancient aberrations are emerging from the deep ocean. Driven by some otherworldly fervor, they encroach upon the local villages, searching with beady eyes for anyone linked to the Gods. Even now you hear rumours of kidnap, men and women dragged kicking and screaming into the depths.

User summary:

For 5th - 10th level characters.

207696.name: Picross Touch
207696.description:
Picross, also known as Nonograms or Paint-By-Numbers, is a very fun and addicting puzzle game. The goal is to complete each puzzle by using the power of logic.

Picross Touch provides you with a fun and hassle free way of playing picross, on your Android device. Each level has been designed to be logically solvable.

Do you think you can solve them all?

Source: The Publisher Website.

207699.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 293 - Jan 2000)
rpg: The Extraordinary Adventures of Baron Munchausen

207700.name: Venus Hostage
207700.description:
User Summary

Venus Hostage is an adult game.

207701.name: Lost Paradise
207701.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

As a fierce warrior in a twisted fantasy world, you explore and fight.

207702.name: Winterfall
207702.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




Anor, the Old Kingdom, fell long ago to the strife of Men who, armed with tools of war, broke Covenant as they turned against one another, muddled by the workings of ancient evil. Far from their minds were hallowed notions of the sacredness of life, the sanctity of nature and the power of love, as much blood was shed, much destruction wrought.

In penance for such great damage, a leaving was sentenced: far from the lush plains and rolling hills of the Old Kingdom and high into the harsh, dry mountains, into the ancestral sanctuaries, the survivors would recede. There would be sought truer, stouter ways, leaving the scarred lands below, forbidden thenceforth, to heal.

Source: The Game Website.

207703.name: Tungsten: Armored Outlaw
207703.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Tungsten is a sidescrolling mech action game. Behind the controls of your devastating power armor, you engage in battles against gorgeous space backgrops.

207704.name: Signalis
207704.description:
User Summary

As an elite agent in Signalis, you sneak through an eerie futuristic facility.

207705.name: Spareware
207705.description:
User Summary

Alongside four friends, Spareware drops you into hectic robot action.

207706.name: Bard Cantrips (3PP)
207706.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Bard Spells is a simple document that collects the bard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level bard spells (cantrips)

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

207707.name: Druid Orisons (PRD)
207707.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level druid spells (orisons).

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207708.name: Druid Orisons (3PP)
207708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level druid spells (orisons).

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and from select third-party products.

207710.name: The Wild World of Madison Jaxx
207710.description:
User Summary

Madison Jaxx heads Global Special Services, a private agency that hires outliers from all areas of expertise to track down over the top tongue-in-cheek criminals all over the world, under the guise of their profession.

207711.name: Night Whisper Lane
207711.description:
User Summary

Survive in a house run by a demon.

207713.description:
A 10 card micro game tied to the "Lords of Rock" card game universe.

This micro game is a challenge between you and the other players to try to get your player Pantheon card into the front and center section of the mosh pit before the concert starts. Flipping and moving card will cause the seating to re-arrange itself and you have to be good enough to try to make sure your card ends up front and center for the concert.

This is a stand alone micro game.
207713.name: Lords of Rock: Mosh Pit

207716.name: Mont a mots alpha
207716.description: The goal is to be the first player to reach the top of his mountain. To do so, each player draw a tile picturing something. If the first letter of the image is on your mountain, you "climbed" it.

207717.name: The Castle Triskelion Mega-Dungeon: Inner Ward First Floor
207717.description:
From the Publisher's Blurb:

The next segment of the Castle Triskelion mega-dungeon is now available: the Inner Ward First Floor!

This module features 65 encounter areas, and while no new monsters are introduced … you’ll need to download the free New Materials Volume II, which features 30+ new monsters, new magic items, new mundane items, and new information about currencies of the realms!

207718.description: This expansion brings 9 new characters and adds a little bit of uncertainity to the game via random events or fluctuations of damage.
207718.name: Bestiary of Sigillum: Forge of Chaos

207719.name: Hop le j'ton
207719.description:
Come in our fun fair and relive the feeling of the penny-fall game!
Play your chips on the board, push , and... shall fall or not?...
Win points but careful not to be too greedy at the risk of having no more chips to play your turn!
Here we go!

207720.name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Battle of the Bulge
207720.description: The Ardennes, 1944. Driven back by the Allies since D-Day, Germany launches a surprise offensive on the Western Front. This assault against the unprepared Allied lines is the opening move in one of the largest battles of World War II. This new Campaign Book for Bolt Action allows players to take command of both armies in this desperate battle, fighting it as they believe it should have been fought. New, linked scenarios, rules, troop types and Theatre Selectors provide plenty of options for novice and veteran players alike.

207721.name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Sea Lion
207721.description: The year is 1940, and the German invasion of Britain has begun. With this new campaign book for Bolt Action, players can fight the battles of World War II's greatest 'what if' scenario. Defend the cliffs of Dover and the beaches of Kent from wave after wave of German landing craft. Parachute into the Home Counties in a surgical strike to capture Winston Churchill. Rally the Home Guard in a last, desperate attempt to keep England free of the Nazi invaders! Containing new rules, scenarios, and unit types covering all of the unique features of this alternate history campaign, it offers a chance for all Bolt Action players to truly rewrite the history of World War II.

207722.description:
Game description from the publisher:
Samurai are fiercely guarding their secrets and daymyo does not forgive slightest offense. However not even that can stop ninjas from stealing mystical scrolls for their masters. Now thieves face most difficult task – escape from village surrounded by samurai!

Ninja Cats are fast tactical game for 2-4 players. Use your cards to maneuver your pawn in such manner so you will be not surrounded by enemies or angry samurai.

Game description from the publisher (Polish):
Samuraje zazdrośnie strzegą swoich sekretów, a daymyo nie wybacza najdrobniejszej zniewagi.
Lecz nawet to nie powstrzymało ninja przed wykradnięciem tajemnych zwojów w imieniu swoich panów.
Teraz przed złodziejami stoi najtrudniejsze zadanie – ucieczka z osady otoczonej przez samurajów...

NINJA KOTY to szybka taktyczna gra dla 2-4 osób. Przy użyciu kart manewrujemy swoim pionkiem w taki sposób, aby nie zostać otoczonym przez przeciwników oraz rozzłoszczonych samurajów.
207722.name: Ninja Cats

207723.name: QuickShot Python
207723.description:
User Summary

Another multiplatform joystick by SpectraVideo's QuickShot label.
This is a joystick most people either love or hate.

In Python-1 series there are at least two models; the difference here is digital (Python-1 QS-130F) or analouge (Python-1M QS-137F) micro switches.

The joystick have a "modern classic", ergonomic jet fighter handle with two fire-buttons; One for the thumb and one for the index finger. Under the thumb botton is found a blue switch for Auto-fire.

QuickShot Python-1 was originally released for a handfull of home computers. With Python-1M more were added to the fan.
For NES and SNES, Python-2 (QS-130N) and Python-2B (QS-197E) was made - these had some differences compared to Python-1:
Python 2 / QS-130N for Nintendo Entertainment System; two blue buttons is added next to the thumb fire button.
Python 2B / QS-197E for Super Nintendo Entertainment System was white instead of black. The red index button stayed red, but the red thumb button changed shape and colour to Yellow. The buttons added next to got an arrowed shape and was green (left side) and blue (right side). The base got six small, gray buttons added. The autofire switch changed to gray.

Specially for SEGA there was also made a Python-3 (QS-135) with three fire bottons; the thumb button was "split" into two buttons, in a U-shape, between those was added a blue START button.

207724.name: QuickJoy III SuperCharger SV-123
207724.description:
User Summary

Third QuickJoy board, in a lovely Ferarri-red base and a black handle.
Was equipped with standard 9-pin D-socket

207725.name: Tiny Armies
207725.description:
Build your own army, destroy your enemies and most of all, have fun! Tiny Armies is a funny card game for 2-4 players with strategy and a bit of luck. It plays in 20-40 minutes depending on the number of players.

You draw cards to help build your army, consisting of various different units. Units are then recruited from hand, spies are potentially played and you attack enemy units to score stars.

The objective is to gain the most stars with the game ending at a pre-set number of stars. You gain stars by destroying enemy units and stealing them from other players.

207726.name: QuickJoy II SV-122
207726.description:
User Summary

Black, rectangular base (Turbo-version (SV-124) have red base). The stick have fingermold, and two buttons (thumb and index finger) and a switch to the left of the thumb buttom. There is also a switch on the base.

On both regular and Turbo models, stick is black, and switch and buttons are red.

207727.name: QuickJoy Junior SV-199
207727.description:
User Summary
Originally produced by German Jollenbeck GmbH. The handle have a pistol grip with finger molds, which have a fire button for the index finger. There is also a button on the base (top left).

Year is a guess/estimate

207728.name: Optimo+
207728.description:
Game description from the designer:

Optimo+ is the reimplementation of Optimo! It contains the base game and an expansion for younger players (7+) with different cards and rules, but using the same mechanism.

Optimo! is a fast-paced word game in which you have to be the quickest to find the best word with each round's setting. In each round, you have a combination of six cards with constraints (letter or lexical). These constraints can be a requirement (i.e. you must use the letter "E" or you must have six letters in the word) or a ban (i.e. you can't use verbs or you can't have a word with 4 or less letters). Then you must find a word that corresponds to at least 4 constraints, then trigger the timer to give the other players 30 seconds more to find a better word than yours. Pondering if you should find a 5(or 6)-constraint word or go fast with a 4-constraint word to get the fastest-player bonus but risk losing it all to a better word is the core mechanic of the game.

Optimo kids is an easy and fast-aced word game in which you have a combination of 4 cards with constraints (letter, lexical and theme) which can be requirements or bans. Players must find a word that fits the 4 constraints or launch a "dare" to the other players, leaving them 30 seconds to come up with a word or else, the "darer" wins the round.

207729.name: The Edge: Dawnfall
207729.description:
The Edge: Dawnfall is a dynamic, miniature and card battle game with elements of territory control (gathering crystals) as well as campaign play. Each player controls unique units with special abilities that can be enchanted with special spell or progress cards.

Players win the game in solo or co-op mode by completing plot conditions of the scenario, or in the competitive skirmish mode by gaining advantage of 7 Victory Points. The game is set in the original post-apocalyptic universe of The Edge and features 6 factions with very different backstories, game styles and aesthetics.

207730.name: Cleric/Oracle Orisons (PRD)
207730.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Cleric/Oracle Spells is a simple document that collects the cleric/oracle spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level cleric/oracle spells (orisons).

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207731.name: Cleric/Oracle Orisons (3PP)
207731.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Cleric/Oracle Spells is a simple document that collects the cleric/oracle spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level cleric/oracle spells (orisons).

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and from select third-party products.

207732.name: Witch Cantrips (3PP)

From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Witch Spells is a simple document that collects the witch spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level witch spells (cantrips)

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

207733.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Witch Spells is a simple document that collects the witch spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level witch spells (cantrips)

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207734.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level magus spells (cantrips)

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207735.name: Magus Cantrips (3PP)
207735.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level magus spells (cantrips)

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

207736.name: Bard Cantrips (PRD)
207736.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Bard Spells is a simple document that collects the bard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 0-level bard spells (cantrips)

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207737.name: Coalition Field Manual
207737.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Coalition Field Manual for Savage Rifts® new armor, weapons, vehicles, and other gear give your Dead Boy soldiers the latest and greatest in Coalition States' technology. Suit up today!

207738.name: Asteroid Cybele: The American Wasteland
207738.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is 20 years after the Cybele asteroid impacted in the Pacific Ocean. North America is covered in sand. How well will you survive?

A new campaign pack set in America covering Miami, and parts of America for Aftermath!

Miami is struggling to keep going. Gangsters and Casinos rule the streets. The Casinos sponsor an annual race from Miami to Seattle – no rules.

Across America, small commutinies are still alive – some struggling, some thriving. Seattle has been rebuilt as a high-tech Babylon. Can you and your team make it from Miami to Seattle alive?

207739.name: Area/Building and Room Generator
207739.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create areas fileld with various, appropriate rooms with a few dice rolls! Roll a d20 on the Area table, then move to the appropriate table and roll a few d20s to generate some rooms.

207740.name: The Shroomkin
207740.description:
From publisher blurb:

The origins of the mysterious fungal humanoid race known as shroomkin, called fungimen or
shroomen by others, is still a mystery even to the greatest of scholars (which prefer to refer to them as myconoids).

Despite their mysterious origins all scholars can agree that the shroomkin share a great deal
with fungus and mushrooms (hence their name), biologically at least, their bodies as diverse as any mushroom you have encountered. Most of them possess caps, gills on the underside of their caps, and their bodies are composed of the same leathery materials as a mushroom’s stem, some shroomkin warriors however develop chitinous tissue. All of them can release spores, each spore containg a different effect such as turning dead bodies into food, controlling other creatures, causing extreme pain, and even spores that puts their target to sleep. They may be small but they have all the tools they need to survive.

This product contains two files:

A 21 page playbook containing over 20 moves, gear, poisons, transportation, and magic items.
A compendium class: The Fungilord
A two page character sheet for you to record your character's stats, gear, and moves.

207741.name: Violetta
207741.description: One set of 5 different colored discs for each player participating and the "Violetta" piece are placed (one piece on one space) in a random pattern on the game board. The playing pieces start on the corner spaces. Movement is determined by a die and is allowed in any direction, but not diagonal. If a playing piece gets on a space with a disc it needs next, it collects the disc. The discs may only be collected in the right order, beginning with the largest (red) and ending with the smallest (blue). The playing pieces may only enter empty spaces or spaces with the next disc they Need. When a player has collected all 5 discs, he further needs to collect "Violetta" to win the game.

207742.name: Griffonport
207742.description:
From publisher blurb:

As Griffonport expanded, what began as a few taverns around the docks expanded to a thriving melting pot—a community of sailors, wanderers, merchants, and those who derive a living from the sea. Decades of growth have changed this small hamlet to a thriving port city.

A complete port city backdrop, ready to insert into any campaign world. Compatible with 3.5 and Pathfinder Rules sets, Griffonport is a facinating and intrigue filled city. Come check out what all the fuss is about!

30 pages
40 unique locations
50 colorful NPC's
and dozens of story hooks for years of adventure!

207743.name: Locations
207743.description:
From publisher blurb:

This volume is themed around locations, some real, some only a legend, others that have been lost to the mists of time.
Inside this edition, you'll find chunks related to...

Angkor Wat
Chichen Itza
Death Valley
El Dorado
Giants Causeway
Ishtar Gate
Machu Picchu
Mendenhall Glacier & Ice Caves
Pamukkale
Stonehenge

207744.name: Whispers & Rumours: Borderland Town (Pathfinder)
207744.description:
From publisher blurb:

After surviving a long, dangerous stint in the untamed regions of the world, the PCs find themselves back in civilisation. Upon entering a settlement, the players decide to scope out the area and get a feel for the local goings-on by talking to inhabitants and gathering information. At this point, they ask “so what are the local rumours around here, anyway?” Whispers & Rumours: Borderland Town is here to answer just that question, providing the time-pressed GM with hundreds of local rumours suitable for fleshing out the society of almost any borderland settlement.

207745.name: Whispers & Rumours: Borderland Town (System Neutral Edition)
207745.description:
From publisher blurb:

After surviving a long, dangerous stint in the untamed regions of the world, the PCs find themselves back in civilisation. Upon entering a settlement, the players decide to scope out the area and get a feel for the local goings-on by talking to inhabitants and gathering information. At this point, they ask “so what are the local rumours around here, anyway?” Whispers & Rumours: Borderland Town is here to answer just that question, providing the time-pressed GM with hundreds of local rumours suitable for fleshing out the society of almost any borderland settlement.

This book is compatible with every edition of the world's most popular role-playing game.

207746.name: The Precentor - New Paladin Archetype
207746.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new Paladin archetype whose voice lifts even the heavens above, the Precentor. The creation of James Cooke, this archetype melds the bardic performance with the holy service of the paladin. Three new alternate divine bonds are also presented to extend the flexibility of the paladin.

207747.name: Reign of Chaos
207747.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ad Infinitum Adventures presents an adventure for ICONS: Superpowered Roleplaying, usable a a stand-alone or as a part of the Rise of the Phalanx series of adventures.

It began with Flight of the Nova-1 and progressed through Cold War Conundrum, The Nemesis Crisis, and The Metaskulk Invasion — and now the Rise of the Phalanx saga for Icons Superpowered Roleplaying comes to its climatic conclusion with Reign of Chaos, where the heroes of Victory City learn the history of their predecessors and confront the mastermind behind the looming threat from Geistspace. Can they save the city, and the world, from the terrible vengeance of Reign…?

Reign of Chaos includes the complete roster and character sheets for the original members of the Phalanx, along with Reign, his mystic minions, and all of his secrets.

207748.name: Insupposable Instruments
207748.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lij might be the City Of Wonders, but it is not the only place in Rûl where wondrous and powerful treasures can be found. Indeed, all across the continent one can unearth fantastical items, mundane and magical. From the worktable in a tinker’s shop to the scores of neatly labeled bottles crowding the shelves of an alchemist’s lab, the people of the Empire and beyond prove indefatigable when it comes to transforming raw materials into useful and interesting forms.

Insupposable Instruments catalogs a host of new items to add to your Shadow of the Demon Lord game. These peripherals can be found in dusty street markets or shady back alley deals, by grave digging or dungeon delving. For ease of use, each listing is separated into a category of item type.

207750.name: Zero Gravity
207750.description:
Zero Gravity is a beautiful first-person/third-person puzzle-platformer simulation game where you will undergo four types of gamemodes.

Source: The Developer Website.

207751.name: Black Hole Hazard
207751.description:
Black Hole Hazard is an action puzzle spacewalking game with unique control and a fascinating sci-fi story. Controlling the gun's recoil in space and distorted gravity will be very challenging. Be Dr. Albert, shoot the jet / laser gun to survive against the unknown enemies and find out the truth.

Source: The Game Website.

207752.name: Frantic Freighter
207752.description:
https://www.facebook.com/phr00ts.software

Frantically attempt a delivery across space in a freighter. Unfortunately, your ship is constantly falling apart. Trade spare parts, find stashes & evade pirates along the way. Succeed to unlock challenges!

207753.name: Arena: For the Gods!
207753.description:
Arena: For the Gods! has two phases. First, players use their life points to bid for the best equipment, mounts, and weapons. Second, they fight! When one player dies, the game ends, and whoever has the most life points left wins.

All cards in the game have a mythological theme, featuring some of the most famous members of various cultures' myths and histories, such as Mjölnir, Osiris, and Quetzalcoatl.

207755.name: The Final Station
207755.description:
Travel by train through a dying world. Look after your passengers, keep your train operational, and make sure you can always reach the next station. Make your way through swarms of infected at each station. Explore mysterious and abandoned stations looking for supplies and survivors.

Source: The Game Website.

207756.description:
Description from the publisher:

Is your goblin horde more of a goblin clique? Not for long! Swell your goblin ranks with Munchkin Pathfinder: Truly Gobnoxious, a booster pack with ten new monster cards and five goblin-related treasures for use with Munchkin Pathfinder or any other Munchkin title.
207756.name: Munchkin Pathfinder: Truly Gobnoxious

207757.name: Tahira: Echoes of the Astral Empire
videogamehonor: 2016 AGD Awards Excellence In Representation Nominee
207757.description:
Tahira: Echoes of the Astral Empire is a tactical turn-based RPG, set on a world fallen into a medieval dark age after the collapse of a spacefaring civilization.

You must guide Tahira, the 20-year-old princess of Avestan, on the most challenging night of her life as she fights to save her people from the genocidal Astral Empire.

You’ll fight large-scale tactical turn-based battles using guerrilla warfare tactics, including ambushing enemies, taking cover and knocking foes off cliffs. You’ll also develop relationships with those traveling with you and uncover secrets of a time when man traversed the stars with impunity.

Source: The Game Website.

207758.name: Windscape
207758.description:
In Windscape you play as a young girl living on your parents’ farm, set in a lovely world made up of floating islands in the sky. As you discover the world you learn that something has gone terribly wrong - islands are breaking apart and falling from the sky!

Source: The Developer Website.

207759.name: Second Coming
207759.description:
Second Coming is a sci-fi cartoon gamebook with turn-based 3D battles (xcom-style). It is a sci-fi adventure where you and your team explore an alien ship and uncovers its secrets.

Source: The Developer Website.

207760.name: DragonBlast VR
207760.description:
User Summary

Choose your dragon and defend the village against invaders.

207761.name: Agent Walker: Secret Journey
207761.description:
Find the Spear of Destiny to save the world!

Source: The Publisher Website.

207762.name: Earthlock: Festival of Magic
207762.description:
What starts as a simple quest for desert scavenger Amon soon sprawls into a journey where several unlikely heroes join to save Umbra, a beautiful but harsh world that mysteriously stopped spinning thousands of cycles ago.

Explore the world of Umbra and face myriads of monsters in exhilarating turn-based combat. Kiting lets you strategically take on as many enemies as you like. The more enemies the more experience gained.

Source: The Game Website.

207763.name: De-Void
207763.description:
De-Void is a first-person adventure game, where the player unravels the mysterious circumstances surrounding the disappearance of a remote space colony crew.

Source: The Developer Website.

207764.name: Time Bomb
207764.description:
In this fast card game, a bomb is in the center of the table, showing in how many seconds it will explode.
Each player, at their turn must play a card that sometimes increases and very often decreases the countdown. When the counter reaches 0 or less, the bomb explodes and the player who played the last card loses a life point. All the other player can try to escape, but the slowest one will lose a life point, too!

There are also some special bombs and cards with special effects.

207765.name: The Lords of the Earth Flame
207765.description:
https://www.facebook.com/tlotef

The Lords of The Earth Flame is a novel game created in the best traditions of interactive fiction and text-based role-playing. Non-linear structure, rich text core, and the “analog” feel of times past are certain to provide unforgettable gaming experience for hours on end.

207766.name: To Recover The Fallen
207766.description:
St. Michael is a city on the Great lakes. In it's industrial zone is a well guarded compound owned by a well respected multi-millionaire. The company is repute to be working on a covert Navy program and their security is formidable. There are several security checkpoints, video surveillance, and a well trained guard force. Our initial investigation has found no official confirmation of such a program, but this may be due to a bureaucratic mix-up. Unconfirmed reports of an alien craft within the compound have compelled us to authorize a mission to investigate what is going on. Is the activity within the compound a secret government program, or are there external forces at work?

This Xenoforce adventure module is recommended for 3-8 characters and is suitable for all experience levels. This module deals with violent situations and parental/guardian supervision is recommended to minors.

207767.name: GravPool
207767.description:
A simulation of the version of billiards that space pilgrims played during the starship migrations of the 2300s. Instead of aiming for pockets on a flat plane, you have six degrees of freedom with which to aim your shots. There are some new obstacles that make things a little more chaotic.

Source: The Game Website.

207768.name: Champions of Anteria
207768.description:
Welcome to Anteria, a magical kingdom that’d be rather delightful if it wasn’t enslaved by a bloodthirsty horde of enemy factions that have more evil tricks than you can imagine.

Source: The Publisher Website.

207769.name: Four Sided Fantasy
207769.description:
Four Sided Fantasy is a wordless, seamless experience in which you have the ability to maneuver past obstacles using screen wrap. When you leave one side of the screen, you “wrap around” and come out on the other side, much like in Pac-Man or Asteroids.

Source: The Game Website.

207770.name: Talent Not Included
207770.description:
User Summary

Set in the fantasy land of Notthatmuchfurther, Talent Not Included tells the story of three actors, ready for anything, in order to give the performance of their life.

207771.name: Hue
videogamehonor: 2015 Indie Prize Best in Show: Critic's Choice Winner
2015 Indie Prize Best Kids/Family Game Winner
2016 AzPlay Awards Best Game Design Nominee
2016 AzPlay Awards Most Re-Playable Game Nominee
207771.description:
Hue is a vibrant, award-winning puzzle-adventure, where you alter the world by changing its background colour.

Source: The Game Website.

207772.name: Teschi & Ceppi: Saga Completa
207772.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nuovo Adventure Path per il gioco di ruolo Pathfinder, presentato nel formato "Omnibus" che include tutto il materiale della saga in un unico prodotto di oltre 500 pagine interamente a colori, con splendida copertina cartonata

I Liberi Capitani dei Ceppi minacciano da tempo le rotte marittime dell’Oceano Arcadiano al largo della costa occidentale del Garund, instillando paura nei cuori dei capitani mercanti di tutto il Mare Interno. Nessuna nazione, però, ha sentito il morso della frusta dei signori dei
pirati più del Cheliax. Il Casato Thrune brama ancora vendetta contro i pirati, dopo una pesante sconfitta subita dalla sua flotta molto tempo fa. Ha covato a lungo la propria rabbia, ma la resa dei conti con i Liberi Capitani è rimasta solo un sogno per molti anni, mentre il Re Uragano Kerdak Pugnodosso accresceva la portata e la potenza della flotta pirata più di quanto avesse fatto chiunque altro nella sua storia. Ora, però, il Casato Thrune ha un mezzo per assicurarsi l’annientamento dei signori dei pirati e mettere fine una volta per tutte alla supremazia sui mari della confederazione dei Ceppi, assoggettando forse per sempre quelle isole selvagge e famigerate al proprio dominio.
La Saga Teschi e Ceppi contiene:

La Guida alla Saga, con le regole per creare personaggi adatti alla trama dell'avventura grazie a background e suggerimenti di gioco specifici.
Tutti i sei capitoli della Saga originale.
Un excursus dettagliato sulla vita a bordo di una nave pirata, sul combattimento navale e sulle composizioni di navi e flotte.
Un approfondimento su Porto Periglio, sui signori dei pirati che infestano i Ceppi e sui misteri che si celano tra le famigerate isole e negli abissi degli oceani e dei mari di Golarion.
Rivelazioni sulla misteriosa e semi scomparsa civiltà dei ciclopi e su Besmara, la dea adorata dalla maggior parte delle ciurme pirata.
Un ricco bestiario con moltissimi nuovi mostri degli abissi marini, come la balena senzafaccia, l'incutilis, i sahuagin mutanti e lo zombi spina del vuoto.





Translation courtesy of Google:

New Adventure Path for the role play Pathfinder, presented in the "Omnibus" format that includes the entire saga of material in a single product of more than 500 full-color pages, with stunning hardcover

The Free Captains of strains threaten long sea routes Arcadian Ocean off the west coast of Garund, instilling fear in the hearts of the captains merchants around the Inland Sea. No nation, however, felt the bite of the whip of the lords of
more than Cheliax pirates. The House Thrune still craves revenge against the pirates, after a heavy defeat suffered by his fleet a long time ago. He hatched long their anger, but the showdown with the Free Captains remained just a dream for many years, while the King Hurricane Kerdak Pugnodosso increased the scope and power of the pirate fleet more than he did anyone else in his history. Now, however, the House Thrune has a way of ensuring the destruction of the pirate lords and put an end once and for all to the supremacy on the seas of the confederation of strains, maybe forever subjecting these wild islands and notorious to its domain.
Saga Skulls and strains contains:

The Guide to Saga, with the rules for creating characters suitable to the plot of the adventure thanks to the background and specific game suggestions.
All six chapters of the original saga.
A detailed overview on the life on board a pirate ship, the naval combat and on ships and fleets compositions.
A study of Porto peril, the pirate lords who infest the strains and the mysteries that lie between the infamous islands and in the depths of the oceans and seas of Golarion.
Revelations about the mysterious and semi-dead civilization Cyclops and Besmara, the goddess worshiped by most pirate crews.
A rich bestiary with many new monsters of the deep sea, as senzafaccia whale, the incutilis, the sahuagin mutants and zombies plug the vacuum.

207773.name: Feats of Destruction
207773.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Feats of Destruction includes twelve new feats for sappers, sunderers, and wreakers of havoc who want to add a little flair to their attacks and maneuvers : Breaching Burst, Breaker, Construct Demolitionist, Crush Armor, Destructive Charge, Dismantler, Heave-Ho, Improved Destructive Charge, Improved Wrecking Ball, Routine Maintenance, Trapfinding Expert, and Wrecking Ball.

207774.name: Hatsune Miku: Project Diva X
207774.description:
The game takes a new approach to play style, focusing around the theme of "Live and Produce".

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hatsune_Miku%3A_Project_DIVA_X Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA X]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

207775.name: Capture the Troll
207775.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here's a challenge for you. Cross a monster-guarded lake, penetrate an immense cavern system, find the legendary fungoid forest, and capture a troll for the menagerie of Mingo the Moneyless. Either that, or be turned into a frog. Mingoh is a powerful wizard, utterly ruthless, and quite insane. Capturing a troll is actully not as dangerous as telling him why you wouldn't do this little errand for him.

207776.name: Last Will
207776.description:
Last Will is a digital Escape Room experience, where the players need to infiltrate a grand old mansion, where it's deceased owner has filled it with cryptic riddles and weird puzzles, to keep away intruders. They need to work together, to solve the puzzles in time.

In order to beat the game, the players need to make their way into the center of a grand old mansion, made by a eccentric and paranoid old professor.

The player will be tested in all manner of skills like logic, perception, maths, communication, timing and riddles.

The game can be played alone, or in teams of up to 4 players. The mansion is randomly generated each time, so the experience is fresh and challenging.

The game can be played in ESCAPE ROOM MODE with a countdown clock, or in FREE PLAY where you can set your own pace.

The game has some mild occult and creepy undertones, without going all out on a horror/slasher limb.

Source: The Developer Website.

207777.name: Sword's Path — Glory, Book 2: Role Playing
207777.description:
From the back cover:

The Ultimate Role Playing System

This book, the second of a series, is a complete and realistic look at the capabilities of a character in the game world. This system is modular, the rules and ideas may be used with other magic or combat systems. The Sword's Path — Glory role playing system includes these features:


A Karma System with which characters have an incentive to be either "Good" or "Evil."
The Player Character: his strengths and weaknesses.
Over 55 Skills and Abilities in such diverse areas as combat, hunting, or
Skill Training and Physical Conditioning
Skill Tradeoffs, Economics, and Morale
Recovery from Wounds and Medical Aid and Skills
Physical Endurance and Fatigue


This system contains concepts never before seen in a role playing game. The more experienced player will be able to use this system to add new depth to their role playing.

We invite YOU to walk the Sword's Path and move up to the Leading Edge.


From the SPG Overview section:

Sword's Path — Glory is a set of rules covering all aspects of role playing in either a historical or fantasy background, with ancient or medieval technology. This is Book 2 of the series. It deals with character development and skills, endurance, morale, and the Karma System.

207778.name: Sword's Path — Glory, Book 1: Combat System
207778.description:
From the back cover:

The Ultimate Medieval Melee System

At last, a realistic hand-to-hand combat system. First in a series of role-playing aids stressing accuracy, the Sword's Path — Glory combat system includes these features:


Simultaneous movement and combat, without turns or written orders.
The effects of agility, speed, and strength on combat performance.
The effects of weapon weights and designs, stabbing, slashing, or impact.
The first accurate representation of armor protection, based on actual penetration tests.
And, above all, over 67 anatomical hit-location tables which do away with "Hit Points" and other such arbitrary measures of how many times you have to hit the ogre to kill him. Stab him in the heart and he'll die the first time!


This system is fast, simple, and yet because of the data provided, a highly realistic simulation of weapons, armor, and physical damage. This realism, combined with the simultaneous movement and combat system, provides a unique and efficient blend of realism and playability. It has been designed for the experienced player, and is recommended for the age group 16 and over. The system provides the conscientious game-master and/or war gamer the opportunity to inject the ultimate realism into any hand-to-hand combat.

We invite YOU to walk the Sword's Path and move up to the Leading Edge.


From the SPG Overview section:

Sword's Path — Glory is a set of rules covering all aspects of role playing in either a historical or fantasy background, with ancient or medieval technology. This is Book I of the series and deals only with hand-to-hand combat.

207779.name: Ostfront: Combined Arms WW2 Game
207779.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Ostfront is the result of 5 years of research and play-testing. Its a comprehensive World War 2 system aimed at historical accuracy, balance and fun. The rules have been streamlined over the years, and we would consider it "fast play" - Its quick, brutal and rewards bold commanders with sound tactics.

Ostfront covers Infantry, Light Vehicles, all varieties of Tanks and Self-Propelled guns, Artillery in the form of Field Guns and Howitzers, Air Support and Air defense, as well various other forms of support and fortifications. It can be played in any theater of WW2, from North Africa to the Pacific. Aimed at 1/72, 1/100 or smaller scale miniatures. It would also work fine for 28mm.

The Ostfront system is all about combined arms - it plays at a Company to Battalion level, with the smallest unit being the Infantry Platoon. Infantry are deployed in bases, each one representing about 25 men for regulars, and about 10 men for the veteran Assault Infantry units. At 1/72 scale we usually use 3-4 miniatures per base, meaning you can make a large amount of bases from any cheap infantry box - one airfix box of 48 miniatures would give you 10 bases.

Tanks are of course a large part of Ostfront battles, with the average game fielding anywhere from 1 to 20 of them per side, sometimes more in larger games. Light vehicles play an important role, and reconnaissance has a tangible effect in-game - he who scouts out the area first can gain a tactical advantage.

We Split WW2 into 3 periods, allowing balanced battles to be fought and still capture the feelings of operations like Barbarossa and Operation Torch. Its not always about who has the most heavy tanks - in fact heavy tanks are somewhat expensive in the points system, due to the difficulty with which they were produced, maintained and transported. During early war players will need to rely on light tanks, Infantry, Artillery and air strikes to secure their objectives. Mid war covers Kursk style battles - with the Tiger, Panther and Sherman all making an appearance, but before heavier Soviet tanks like the IS-2 or T-34/85 had come into action. Late war covers all the late war toys, from the JagdTiger and Tiger II to the Pershing, to the aforementioned IS-2, among many others.

Ostfront also has a campaign system for combination map-and-tabletop play, allowing you to get that glorious combination of grand strategy and tabletop tactics. The campaign allows up to 5 players to go head-to-head on a map of Europe and North Africa, from Spain to Russia, Scandinavia to Egypt. Each faction fights to control production centres - where they produce more forces each turn, and to spread their supply lines out to the places they need to conquer. A technology race is also implemented, with players who control Tech Centres able to produce slightly more advanced units - even extending to post war tanks if the game is currently in late war - ever wanted a good reason to use a Maus or IS-3? Well here's your chance.

Every time forces make contact on the Campaign map, an Ostfront tabletop battle is fought, with the amount of points on the campaign map dictating how many points you can use in your table top battle. After the battle the results are applied to the Campaign: if you lost 50% of your forces during the game, your force on the Campaign map will also lose 50%. If you were able to win the objectives and cut off your enemies supply train on the table, you will be able to force him back on the campaign map.

This connectedness makes each tabletop battle have a purpose, and adds a lot of flavor to the game as a whole. You might know you're horribly outnumbered, but you need to give the enemy force a bloody nose while you wait for your main force and your allies to come to your aid, and so you will build a specific list for that game, and that purpose. The campaign also allows for combined attacks, out-flanking maneuvers, encirclement and cutting off of supply lines, and a free-form diplomacy system is also implemented.

Two Campaign maps are available for free download, one is a balanced map for a slightly ahistorical but balanced campaign. The other is a realistic map for a more accurate WW2 campaign.

207780.name: Our USA: Products and Resources
207780.description: This was an educational game from Selchow and Righter that was part of a series of at least 3 "Our USA" games. The cover states it is for ages 7 to 14. The game includes a map of the US with a winding path, a spinner, and cards corresponding to resources that could be collected along the path (e.g. Wyoming -- wood). The object is to complete a full circuit of the path.

207782.name: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt – Complete Edition
videogamecompilation: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Hearts of Stone
The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt – Blood and Wine
207782.description:
User Summary

Includes all DLC and expansions.

207783.name: POW!
207783.description:
In POW, players need to collect both superheroes and supervillains over the course of the game, and they do this by rolling dice.

On a turn, the active player rolls five dice up to three times, setting aside at least one die after each roll. Once they stop, they can collect a hero or villain from the shared supply as long as they have the right number of symbols of the proper type (hero or villain) to match one of the tiles on display. If they do, they take this tile and add it to the top of their hero or villain stack. Heroes are worth positive points, and villains negative points.

Alternatively, if the player rolls three speech balloons of a single color, they can collect the top tile of this color from any player's stack. If they roll four or five speech balloons, they can take a specific tile from any player's stack. (They can't look through the stacks, though, so everyone needs to remember who took which tiles when.)

If a player can't take anything, they take the tile with the lowest (possibly negative) score still in the supply.

Once all the tiles have been claimed, the game ends. If someone has more heroes than villains, they must discard tiles from their hero stack until the two stacks are the same height. Players then tally their points, and whoever has the highest score wins!

207784.name: 300 Descriptive Adjectives For Dungeons and Items
207784.description:
300 adjectives to help breathe life into your dungeons and items.

- Publisher's description

207785.name: 300 Mundane Items and Objects
207785.description:
300 standard, non-magical items and objects. Useful for generating interesting magical items, or simply filling up a loot chest!

- Publisher's description

207786.name: Magissa Guia de Inicio
207786.description:
(SPA) del blog de la autora

La Guía de Inicio es la introducción ideal para Magissa y para aprender a jugar al rol. Con ella los jugadores podrán acercarse al juego y vivir sus aventuras directamente.

En la guía se explican las funciones más básicas del juego, haciendo un personaje de ejemplo y explicando algunas reglas. Además, es posible jugar una pequeña aventura de introducción.


(EN, translated by Google) From the author's blog

Home Guide is ideal for Magissa introduction and to learn to play the role. With it, players will approach the game and live their adventures directly.

The guide even the most basic functions of the game are explained, making a sample character and explaining some rules. In addition, you can play a small introductory adventure.

207787.name: La balada del Rey Transparente (I)   v.1.0
207787.description:
(SPA)extraído del módulo

El rey Arturo tiene un problema pero bien gordo y es que ¡se está
volviendo transparente! Un asunto que lo tiene de los nervios y
con razón, pues no tiene ni idea de qué es lo que está pasando.


(EN, translated by Google) extract from the module

King Arthur has a problem but good fat is that it is
becoming transparent ! One issue that has nerves and
rightly so, because it has no idea what 's going on.

207788.name: Dice City: Scrap Builder
207788.description:
Dice City: Scrap Builder is a promo card for Dice City with the following ability:

Deactivate an active location in your city to get 1 resource of each different type in its cost.

Scrap Builder is an economic location with a build cost of 3 Iron, a Defense value of 4 and VP value of 2.

207789.description:
Spazz! The Card Game is a card game that tests your concentration and coordination. You know you have finally got the hang of it when you look completely ridiculous!

Gameplay:
All the cards in the deck are dealt out to the players, and they keep their hand face-down, each taking turns placing a card face up in the pile in the middle of the table. When two identical cards are on the top of the pile, all players must perform the correct action. The last player to do so must take the cards from the pile into their hand.
First one to get rid of their hand wins!

Audience:
Suitable for players ages 6 and up, playtime is approximately 10 minutes. Replayability infinite.

Contents:
110 cards
rules booklet
207789.name: Spazz: The Card Game

207791.description: The board extension slides next to the back side of the standard game board, creating a complete board with 70% bigger hexes (the content is the same). All units and resources in Scythe are kept on the board, so the larger hexes provide more space. The standard game board is 624x818mm, and it grows to 818x939mm with this extension.
207791.name: Scythe: Board Extension

207792.name: Onward
207792.description:
User Summary

Onward is a VR tactical multiplayer first person shooter developed by Downpour Interactive.

207793.name: The Last Hope
207793.description:
User Summary

In The Last Hope you play as a scientist that was working on the development of a time machine before everything gone wrong... Now you have to travel through different eras of time and try to survive.

207794.name: Stars
207794.description:
User Summary

Stars is a virtual reality game about stars.

207795.name: Bloxiq VR
207795.description:
Bloxiq takes classic concept of color matching and turns it on its head. Manipulate blocks to connect four or more of the same color above, beside or even through. Conquer obstacles such as bombs, locks and hidden blocks in devilishly clever and addicting challenges.

You’ll need all of your wits as you try to solve 100 levels that will completely change your perspective on puzzle games. Easy to learn, fun to play and sometimes mind-bendingly difficult, Bloxiq’s innovative mechanics make it the perfect game for people who love puzzle games that challenge your brain rather than your luck.

Source: The Developer Website.

207796.description:
The citizens of the Empacta skies long for the days where everyone, not just the wealthy, can ditch their masks and breathe the precious air that they call their home.

As an industrialist, you will collect dust particles from the air and water vapor from the clouds to convert to hydrogen and oxygen.

By collecting, converting and selling these precious resources, you can provide your family with the breathing room that you need to keep your business afloat and go home at night knowing you made a difference to the world with fresh air.

In Ahead in the Clouds, each player can take three actions each turn. Options are either taking/converting resources via connected buildings or Cloudbursting, which is breaking up the established network of buildings. Players can also take free actions during their turn to claim contracts to gain victory points, or connect their habitat to other buildings. Players must also be ready for the blimp from below, which comes every couple of rounds to take resources back down to the land dwellers.

After 8 rounds, the player with the most contracts wins.
207796.name: Ahead in the Clouds

207797.name: Lixso
207797.description:
Lixso is a new and original logic game, somewhere in between Sudoku and a puzzle. Fill a grid entirely using L-shapes with the 4 colors (or matching symbols I,X,S & O), respecting the pre-filled cells, and in such a way that L-shapes with the same symbol/color don’t touch – neither on a side or a corner.
It sounds easy, but there are many ways to fill a 9 by 9 grid with L-shapes. Each grid has only a single correct solution, you will need to use logical reasoning to find it. There are 6 difficulty levels. Try level 1 or 2 to learn the game – one can easily see which symbols fit or not, and with each added L, others become clear. But for level 4, 5 or 6, it is more difficult. Sometimes you have to imagine or place a whole chain of L-shapes to find out if it leads to the solution. First, place those L-shapes of which you are certain. Do observe the entire grid, as sometimes you have to continue on a whole other part of the grid.

Lixso can also be played with 2 to 4 players – rather than solving the puzzle, this becomes a competition to place the most L-shapes on the grid.
The symbols/colors are divided among players. With 2 players each has 2 symbols, with 4 players each has 1. With 3 players each has one symbol, and the remaining symbol is shared among players.
The purpose of the game is to place the most L-shapes.
Place L-shapes in turns, while possible – and keep the count for each player. If you can’t, skip a turn. The game ends when no-one can place another L-shape. The Player who placed the most L-shapes wins.
Rules number 1 and 2 apply: respect the pre-filled cells, and L-shapes with the same symbol cannot touch. (an L-shape also cannot touch a pre-filled cel of the same symbol!)
Rules 3 does not apply – the grid does NOT need to be filled, empty cells can remain.
And herein lies the whole interest of the multiplayer game: rather than placing the L-shapes to solve the puzzle, you place them competitively, trying to limit available space for the other player/s. You can try to place tiles in such a way that parts of the grid (with the symbols/colors) of your opponent/s) become impossible to use.
As a variation, all players can play any of the symbols/colors. (don’t forget to keep count while playing!) This way it is very hard to gain an advantage over the other player.

207798.name: Ordleg
207798.description:
Ordleg ("Word Play" in English) is a word dice game with game play the same as Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes. On your turn, you roll the 15 letter dice and arrange them into a crossword puzzle structure within the one minute time limit. Your score is based on the value of letters used. The player with the highest cumulative score after 10 rounds wins.

Two dice have one blank side. The game comes with two sheets of blank stickers so that you can cover these blank sides (or any other side of any die) and change the letter distribution to suit your preferred language.

Although the game comes with rules for 20 languages, including Greek and Russian, the game uses only the Latin alphabet. However, it comes with 100 blank stickers, enough to cover the sides of all 15 dice.

207799.name: Danger Mouse Secret Agent Card Game
207799.description: Play a card with the same same symbol or colour as the top card of the discard pile. First player to play out all their cards and shout 'Danger Mouse!' wins.

207800.name: Polarity
207800.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bow Before the Master of Magnetism!

A potent meta, with the powers of magnetism, Jakob used his powers in his youth to hunt down and destroy the Nazis who had destroyed his family. During those years, he made an enemy of the Horde, and a friend of Dean Donovan Shepherd. Together, they founded the Meta Commune.

Many years later, after the US Government was revealed to be using metas as soldiers, Jakob, as Polarity, renamed the commune New Avalon and declared it a sovereign nation who was now at war with not only the United States, but also any who supported their policies.

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

207801.name: Centuria
207801.description:
From publisher blurb:

I AM a Demigod!

Even from a young age, Sabine was far larger and stronger than other children around her. She used her strength to get what she wanted from others. Once she discovered she was actually the daughter of the Olypmian god, Ares, she started wearing a Grecian-styled outfit and calling herself Centuria (PL 10).

Sabine now acts as an enforcer for the Crime Cartel and greedily reaps the benefits of this.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

207802.name: The Cursed Fountain
207802.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Mini-Dungeon
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 1-3

A band of kobolds armed with enchanted weapons has started raiding villages along the outskirts of Cutter’s Woods. The villages are looking for a group of brave adventurers to put an end to these attacks.

The Cursed Fountain is part of a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

207803.name: Switch It
207803.description:
A fun & challenging game with a messy room & chaos of night and day. Look out the window, is it sunny outside? Is your messy room full of lights and colors? If so, hurry up and find the COLOR that appears the most. But if it’s night then everything changes! The room is dark and full of shadows, no colors can be seen, only the shapes of the objects. This time try and spot the OBJECT that appearS the most. Hey! Pay attention! Two more objects might be hiding among your mess! a Flashlight and a curtain. They switch things around and turn day into night and night into day creating a FUN MESS OF A CHALLENGE!

How to play?
1The youngest player starts by flipping the first card of the deck and placing it next to it so that the objects side of the card is face up. Now there is the deck of cards with a window card on top and an objects card next to it. If the window card shows day then the players must try and spot the COLOR that appears the most on the card.
2If the window card shows night then the players must try and spot the object that appears the most on the card. Then another card is flipped from the pile by the next player and the game continues.

3
Beware! There are two special objects that change things around. When they appear it doesn’t matter whether its night or day in the window because they switch things around! The winner of the game is the player who collected the most cards.

207804.name: Divinities & Cults Volume II: Roman & Celtic (LL)
207804.description:
From publisher blurb:

EVEN MORE CLASSIC DEITIES FOR YOUR CLASSIC RPG!

Have you unleashed the mighty power of Divinities and Cults in your game yet?

Divinities and Cults: Volume II covers the Gods and Goddesses of both the Celtic and Roman Pantheons, as well as a number of Evil Cults. Like Volume I, this work provides detailed tenets, special cleric considerations, healing side-effects, numerous divine tests, and custom spell lists for all 19 of them. What is more, optional rules and random tables abound, organized by Divinity, of course. This excellent book is compatible with the various Old School Editions and their 'Retro-clones', especially Labyrinth Lord™!

Detailed rules for playing clerics of 7 Celtic and 7 Roman Gods and Goddesses
Full rules for also playing clerics of 5 Evil Cult types
20 pieces of unique artwork by Luigi Castellani (note: some Goddesses are depicted partially nude)
11 Random encounter tables
7 Other random tables
20 Optional rule & sidebar sections
An Appendix that offers guidelines for making over 20 additional Divinities, as well as having cultural variations for clerics of the various Divinities, such as Ionian, German, Etruscan, Gallic, etc.
And much more!

207805.name: Strange Weather
207805.description:
From publisher blurb:

Letters from the Flaming Crab is a monthly series of Pathfinder-compatible supplements. Each Letter focuses on exploring a different topic to give gamemasters and players new, exciting options that can be dropped into any campaign.

Within Strange Weather...

We bring you a dozen new Conditions and Hazards more magical and exciting than a mere thunderstorm! Acid rain, aurora hypnosis, ball lightning, blood storm, ectoplasmic storm, fire whirl, hailstorm, pollen storm, skyquake, blood moon, dread moon, radiant moon, and the solar eclipse!

We also introduce the Storm Elemental with four variants: the blizzard storm elemental, dust storm elemental, hurricane elemental, and lightning storm elemental!

And we finish Strange Weather with two weather related archetypes: the Stormcaller (Shaman) and the Child of the Sky (Barbarian)!

207806.name: Mind And Soul
207806.description:
From publisher blurb:
