Psionics Augmented: Occult continues with the Mind and Soul release! In this PDF, you will find a variety of archetypes for the meserist and spiritualist classes from Pathfinder RPG Occult Adventures, as well as new archetypes for the phantom and wilder.

Included in Psionics Augmented: Occult - Mind And Soul, you will find:

Seven new archetypes
Two archetypes for the mesmerist
Two archetypes for the spiritualist
Two archetypes for the phantom
One archetype for the wilder
Four new feats

207807.name: Prelude to War Adventure Path: The Rose of Death
207807.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Plague of Roses

When bacterial geneticist Dr. Rose is captured by a rebel group with murderous intent, it falls to your travellers to infiltrate their secret base and rescue her. Along the way, they must also intercept a weapons shipment bound for the rebels and deceive their contact within the organization. All the while, millions of lives hang in the balance. Can the travellers stop the Army of Unity before they carry out their nefarious plot and discover who is truly behind their actions?

This volume of Foreven Worlds launches the Prelude to War Adventure Path and includes:

The Rose of Death, a Traveller adventure for 4-5 characters, by Dale C. McCoy, Jr.
The history and gazetteer of Cornath, a planet of refugees who fled Imperium and Zhodani life and engineered an environmental disaster
Details on the military strength and organization of the Army of Unity, a rebel group with deadly ambitions
Four new Contacts, Allies, Rivals, and Enemies for your characters
Four new ships and a space station to flavor your game




Save the Doctor. Save the World!

207808.name: Dark Horse
207808.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever wanted more story in your roleplaying game stories?

In a dark horse story, the protagonist and antagonist are not evenly matched. The odds are stacked heavily in favor of the antagonist. Initially no one takes the protagonist seriously, but over the course of the story they shake off their underdog status to become successful and respected.

Examples of the dark horse plot include Cinderella, Forrest Gump, The Hunger Games, One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest, and Rocky.

207809.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the Kingdom of Al Bisat, four teams of flying carpet riders are preparing for the annual contest held by the Sultan. Each player must guide their team through an ever-changing maze of clouds, which are controlled by the Sultan's djinn! The first team to guide their carpets safely across the game board and land on the opposing palace wins.

In more detail, in Sultans of Wind players must program their actions each turn, choosing amongst eight different wind tokens. By using the wind's power, players can manipulate the board to their benefit. If they are skillful enough, maybe they can catch the djinn flying through the clouds, in which case the djinn must grant them a wish!
207809.name: Sultans of Wind

207810.name: ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS
207810.description:
ROCKETS fire ROCKETS at ROCKETS in this action-arcade, arena-combat, gorgeous festival-of-fireworks!

Source: The Game Website.

207811.name: Reset 1-1
207811.description:
User Summary

The world has ended, Demons have risen to conquer the uninhabited and flourishing nature outside.

207812.name: Vinhos Deluxe Edition: Connoisseur Expansion Pack
207812.description:
The Vinhos Deluxe Edition: Connoisseur Expansion Pack consists of:


Weather (1 tile)
Wineries (4 double-sized tiles)
Vineyards (4 double-sized tiles)
Cellars (4 double-sized tiles)
Ocean Tiles (4 large tiles)

207813.name: Hack, Slash & Backstab
207813.description:
Work together as warrior, rogue, wizard and archer to survive a dangerous world. But only one player will be crowned the winner: it becomes a fight to the death, as betrayal and backstab become the tools of choice.

Source: The Game Website.

207814.name: Shadow Games
207814.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Shadow Games, you must gather enough favours to secure the new star player for your guild. Players use various Plot and Agent cards to bribe, steal, and earn favour, but it is not enough to simply play the cards you receive. Fortune favours the bluffers! Play a card from your hand, and call it anything you want. If you convince your opponents of your lies, you will not only reap the rewards of the card you pretended to have but also gain a powerful bluff bonus that will accelerate your victory. Just don’t get caught— it will cost you valuable favours to save face.

Set in Guild Ball's devious, backstabbing Empire of the Free Cities, Shadow Games is a fast paced game for 2-6 cunning players.

Shadow Games will appeal to all Guild Ball players and any fans of compact, quick-paced card games that involve betraying your friends! Easy to learn and addictive, it's fun for all the family and fast—one game only takes about 15 minutes!

207815.name: Don't Crawl
207815.description:
User Summary

A lone hero and treacherous monsters.

207816.name: Vinhos Deluxe Edition: Experts Expansion Pack
207816.description:
The Vinhos Deluxe Edition: Experts Expansion Pack consists of:


Advertisers and Marketers Experts (8 tiles)
Salesmen Specialists (4 tiles)
Spies Specialists (4 tiles)
Meteorologists Experts (4 tiles)
Reviewers Experts (4 tiles)
Estate Experts (4 tiles)
Public Relations Experts (4 tiles)

207817.name: Battle Knights
207817.description:
Battle Knights is a retro style 2D game in which the player must go through the six realms and defeat each knight that leads their respective realm in order to unite the land. Play as the blue knight, Wonder, who is on a quest to unite the colored realms.

Source: The Developer Website.

207818.name: Vinhos Deluxe Edition: Islands Expansion Pack
207818.description:
The Vinhos Deluxe Edition: Islands Expansion Pack consists of:


Madeira Expansion (small board; 4 tiles and 4 tourist meeples)
Açores Expansion (small board; 4 tiles; 4 larger warehouse tiles; 4 barrels)

207819.name: Magnetta
207819.description:
Magnetta is a side-scrolling action game in the vein of classic NES titles. Jump, shoot, slide and blast your way through unique and challenging levels as you collect new weapons and upgrades, hunt down secret areas, and defeat your enemies to ensure peace in the galaxy.

Source: The Developer Website.

207820.name: Vinhos Deluxe Edition: Tasting Room Expansion Pack
207820.description:
The Vinhos Deluxe Edition: Tasting Room Expansion Pack consists of:


Wine Feature Bottles (4)
Porto Bottles (6)
Wine Rack (1)
Tourist Meeples (8)
Wooden Wineries (19)

207821.name: The Warlock of Firetop Mountain (2016)
videogamehonor: 2016 AGD Awards Excellence In Accessibility Honorable Mention
2016 AGD Awards Excellence In Innovation Nominee
2016 AGD Awards Game of the Year Nominee
207821.description:
The Warlock of Firetop Mountain is a tabletop adventure come to life! This fantasy solo RPG combines unique, simultaneous turn-based combat with a journey that changes based on each figurine you take into Firetop Mountain! Which hero will you take into Zagor's lair THIS time?

Source: The Developer Website.

207822.name: Farce Card Game
207822.description:
Description from the publisher:

Farce is an innovative new word game with an inventive step which creates new possibilities for players to outwit each other and have fun.

The inventive step in Farce divides the English Language into 3 elements (3 types of card) so that multiple cards may be combined to create new and original witty sentences. This hasn’t been done before and is an original feature of Farce.

Farce cards contain fragments of comedy which have been designed to combine with other fragments to generate new and original witty sentences. For each round of Farce each player combines up to 12 cards (comprised of the 3 elements) to make a witty sentence which they then read out to the group. Players use their own creativity to produce something uniquely funny with their cards which they then share with the group. The player who gets the most laughs wins the round.

The group decides on each round which player received the most laughs and awards a Farce Point. If there is any dispute then the dealer for that round has the final say. The dealer rotates after each round.

Farce includes 22 Wild Cards which allow players to insert the name of a fellow player into their farcical sentence, and thereby direct their sentences at each other and make fun of each other. This makes the game all about the players.

Farce is aimed at players aged 17+ as the outputs of the game can include adult humour.

The number of possible card permutations playable is virtually infinite. Players can always create something new with Farce, something original and funny which no one has ever heard before.

207823.description:
A resource gathering game where you are paying off the various noble houses of Dayrm to become the successor of the dead regent to the city of Farsley. You will move your agents to each of the different merchants to gather the fine goods that these noble families desire in order to back your claim to become the next regent.

The modular board allows each game to be unique. Each of the different payoffs can be played randomly under each of the 7 noble houses. The order of the merchants is never the same as they populate around and create the game board. Be the first to gather all the required items and become the next regent of Farsley.
207823.name: Circle of the 7

207824.description:
A mini-expansion that introduces several new projects and powerful event cards.

Discover new weapon projects developed or though of by the Germans, such as the Silbervogel (a sort of shuttle), the Himmelsturmer fligh-pack, the Messerchmitt Me-262 and the Me-163 "Komet", the flying-wing bomber of the Horten brothers and more!

This expansion consists of:


a instruction card
6 new project cards
3 new technology cards
8 new event cards
2 white cubes
boardgameversion: Secret Weapons of the Third Reich: Ahnenerbe Expansion
207824.name: Secret Weapons of the Third Reich: Ahnenerbe Expansion

207826.name: Affectionate: Cats and Cuddles
207826.description:
Be sweet! Be cute! Try to please the humans and be the most cuddled cat! Roll your dice, see how the human is feeling, be mischievous, sweet, or silly! Fun for the whole family!

Each turn players roll their cat dice to determine if they take cuddle tokens from the pool of human cuddles, put cuddles back into the pool, are silly, steal cuddle tokens from other players, or roll the special human die. When there are no cuddle tokens are left in the middle, players count up the number of cuddle tokens they have. The player with the most tokens wins the round.

Players can play until someone wins one, two, or three rounds!

207827.name: Disintegrate
207827.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Spell Power PDFs introduce two pages of themed content for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Spell Power: Disintegrate includes a handful of new feats for fans of the disintegrate spell, plus plot hooks to bring your adventurers in quickly using this spell and these feats!

Feats include Blighting Disintegration, Dire Disintegration, Gruesome Disintegration, Obliterating Disintegration, Mass Disintegration, and the creepy Necrotic Disintegration! The plot hooks wrapped around disintegration include an infuriatingly clever wizard, a twisted necromancer, a lich, and a high -level artificer!

207828.description:
Nightlancer is a competitive cyberpunk game set in the unique dystopian future of 2099. Each player must guide their Nightlancer through a hazardous underworld career, intent on securing their future before society collapses around them.

Each player controls one of 8 unique Nightlancers. They take on challenging missions with multiple choice paths, choosing the option that best utilizes their abilities and options. If they are successful they get paid.

They can invest the money either to improve their pool of options with Black Market or Training cards, or they can invest the money in their Prospects to try to secure victory.

Players can use their hand of Contact cards to gain advantages or obstruct their opponents throughout each game round, or they can save them to help complete Agendas - giving them another path to Prospects.

The player with the most Prospects at the end of the game is the winner.

Nightlancer includes solitaire and cooperative optional rules.
207828.name: Nightlancer

207829.name: Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest – Gina Kersten Promo Card
207829.description:
This card was a give-away during SPIEL'15 in Essen. It features a picture of one of the employees at the booth, Gina.

When you employ Gina, you may buy a Beer card for 2 Love.
During your Employ phase you may buy a Beer cards for 4 Love.

207830.description:
5-­Minute Dungeon is a chaotic, co-­operative, real-­time card game in which players have only five minutes to escape the randomized dungeon. Communication and teamwork are critical to survival because there's no time to form a carefully considered plan — and no predicting what dangers lie ahead.

In more detail, players assume the role of one of ten heroes, each with special cards and abilities. Once the five-minute timer starts, the race is on to defeat all the monsters inside the dungeon. In order to defeat a monster, players must match symbols from their hand with ones on the monster's card. At the end of each dungeon is a powerful dungeon boss — and after the first boss is defeated, the campaign continues to the second boss. Each boss, and each randomized dungeon, gets harder until players reach the fifth and final boss.
207830.name: 5-Minute Dungeon
boardgamepodcastepisode: #33: Captain Sonar on tap; Extra Life & MACE gaming weekends
#43: Coldwater Crown review; Sagrada on tap; Holmes: Sherlock & Mycroft

207831.name: deadEarth Game Master's Handbook
207831.description:
From the introduction:

As the Game Master it is your job to create and control the world in which your player's characters exist. It is your job to guide them through the wasted world of deadEarth. But sometimes even the guide need needs some help. Use this book as a supplement to the Player's Handbook to get yourself started in the world of deadEarth; use it as a reference when you get lost.

207832.name: deadEarth Radiation Table Supplement #1
207832.description:
From the introduction:

Radiation Table Supplements are built to enhance and expand the Radiation Table in the deadEarth Player’s Handbook. You may ask yourself why we would want to expand the 1000 radiations on the original table. The answer is that we are just plain crazy. :-) We keep coming up with new radiations and we thought you’d like to see what we’ve come up with.

207833.name: deadEarth Radiation Table Supplement #2
207833.description:
From the introduction:

Radiation Table Supplements are built to enhance and expand the Radiation Table in the deadEarth Player’s Handbook. You may ask yourself why we would want to expand the 1000 radiations on the original table. The answer is that we are just plain crazy. :-) We keep coming up with new radiations and we thought you’d like to see what we’ve come up with.

207834.name: deadEarth Wilderness Encounters #1
207834.description:
From the introduction:

While you are wandering around in the wilderness of deadEarth, you may stumble upon any number of things. Your Game Master will probably have specific plans for your adventures, but there are always those lull times when you need to find something new to do; this table should help fill in the gaps. Note that this table does not (and should not) represent everything that could happen while you are traveling through the wilderness.

207835.name: deadEarth Equipment Supplement #1
207835.description:
From the introduction:

The [included] lists are meant to supplement the equipment lists found in the deadEarth Player’s Handbook. In some cases, items useful in wilderness campaigns have been repeated here for easy reference. However, players and game masters are advised to make full use of all resources available to them to provide the greatest variety in their campaigning.

207836.name: Cassette Juego: Combate Espacial
207836.description:
Cassette Juego was a very popular late 80´s spin and move series of portable boardgames that were created in Spain by CASA CHICO, but later was very popular in Venezuela and Peru,among other South American countries.(produced by Loklinka and Maxi S.A.)

The game itself was portable with shape of a 80´s old audio cassette, that come with it cassette box. The cassette was displayed in three sections. One is located in what was the function of the die, which was replaced by a rotating wheel with various numbers printed on it. The other two panels formed the board cassette. It was made ​​of metal, for small magnetic chips (usually four, but this varied depending on the game) could adhere securely and not dropped or lost. When not being used, the chips were placed in a small metal plate located on the upper right of the board.

Combate Espacial (Space Combat) was a spin and move game were players try to destroy the enemy spaceship as hunting the spaceship around the board. You spin to move and the first to get the enemy spaceship will be attack.

207839.name: Cassette Juego: Caza del Oso
207839.description:
Cassette Juego was a very popular late 80´s spin and move series of portatile boardgames that were created in spain by CASA CHICO, but later was very popular in Venezuela and Peru,among other southamerican countries.(produced by Loklinka and Maxi S.A.)

The game itself was portable with shape of a 80´s old audio cassette, that come with it cassette box.The cassette was displayed in three sections. One is located in what was the function of the die, which was replaced by a rotating wheel with various numbers printed on it. The other two panels formed the board cassette. It was made ​​of metal, for small magnetic chips (usually four, but this varied depending on the game) could adhere securely and not dropped or lost. When not being used, the chips were placed in a small metal plate located on the upper right of the board.

La Caza del Oso (Bear Hunt) was a spin and move game were players try to capture a Bear. You spin to move and the first to get the Bear will be the ultimate hunter.

207840.name: ATTITUDES (Volume 1, Issue 1 - Oct 2000)
207840.description:
ATTUTUDES
Volume 1, Issue 1
October 20, 2000

Another Thano Terra Inspired Totally Unauthorized Dead Earth Sourcebook

Radiations TT001-TT200

207841.name: deadEarth Character Sheet
207841.description:
User summary:

This two-page character sheet is intended for double-sided print-and-play use. It supports either version of the game, though includes elements exclusive to the 2nd edition.

207842.name: Radiation Manipulations
207842.description:
From the introduction:

Radiation Manipulations is an attempt to organize the radiation manipulations presented in the various deadEarth books and supplements into a single set of tables.

But beyond that, [it attempts] to classify the various radiation manipulations into a variety of sub-tables based on the effects of the radiation manipulation.

207843.name: The World of Synnibarr: Invicta
207843.description:
The Ultimate Adventurer's Guide I
Playtest Final Rev 1.0

From the introduction:

This playtest version has not been edited for release.

This manual is written as if the reader has never played these types of games. The information presented in this volume shall be supplemented in future editions.

User summary:

This item widely was circulated between the publication of the 2nd Edition and the (planned) publication of the 3rd Edition. The contents of the "INVICTA" version are more similar to the 2nd Ed. than the 3rd Ed. (though they were intended to become the 3rd Ed.) and were intended to be used as a Playtest. Several sections of the rules are noted simply as "to be included" in the finished edition. This playtest version was funded by a Kickstarter campaign.

207845.name: Treasure Lair
207845.description:
Description from the publisher:

Lairs with vast treasure await heroes who have the endurance to travel through treacherous locations, are clever enough to overcome encounters with dangerous charlatans, and are brave enough to defeat the fearsome monsters that lurk within.

In Treasure Lair, you must form a party of heroes in order to face the many challenges during your quest — but choose wisely, for each quest requires different skills and abilities. Brute strength may be enough to smash your way into the treasure lair, but stealth and wilderness lore may be vital to your quest for the greatest treasure. Win the most treasure and lead your heroes to victory!

207846.name: Stars In Shadow
207846.description:
Turn-based 4X space strategy with a distinctive artistic style. Compete with alien factions to explore and settle nearby star systems, develop colonies, build fleets to defend against rivals, negotiate with them and conquer them, when necessary. Win by unifying the galaxy, through diplomacy or force.

Source: The Game Website.

207847.description: The Magnates: A Game of Power – O santa piva di Polonia is a promotional card for The Magnates that grants the owner of the card an additional +1 of influence or military power.
207847.name: The Magnates: A Game of Power – O santa piva di Polonia

207848.description:
The World Council is a secret committee unknown to most. They gather leaders from various countries in the globe to determine policy of our world. Its main objectives is maintaining peace, fostering social and economic development, and make sure the world is sustainable for mankind. However, result always comes with a price, the development for the general well-being can also foster the coming Doomsday. Can councilors work together for a better future?

The World Council is a strategic board game for 3 to 8 players. You are one of the country leaders in "The World Council". All players strive to be the first to achieve their countries’ objectives, which determined by their country cards, while preventing the ambition of other leaders, as well as, the end of the world. Player achieves his country’s objectives to win the game.

Each player begins the game with one of the following country cards (Super Power, Totalitarian State, Developed Country, Developing Country, Island Country) which give them different countries’ objectives and an uneven number of hands depends on which country you started with.

Doomsday Cards are used to Presents the closeness of 4 types of Doomsday (World War Index, Starvation index, Global Warming Index, Drought Index). Action Cards provide strategy for Councilors to gain advantage for their country. Building Cards need Resources to construct, but they can also provide Resources or even strategic superiority for their countries and construction of some buildings could also be a part of the objectives to win. Every card have a natural resources value showed on the upper left which can be used to pay building cost of other building. Using natural resources will cause the rise of Doomsday Index, but Resources provided by building will not.

Prepare for the tension and conflict coming from the other players, you will never know when will they be ally or your foe. Each game will be quick and simple, but always a different experience!
207848.name: The World Council

207849.name: O.O.P.ART.
207849.description:
1) INTRODUCTION AND PURPOSE OF THE GAME:
The man uses only 5% of his own mental abilities. What the man perceives some world with his own senses, is alone a small part. Some men are gifted, or/they have developed some particular mental faculties for which they have the an opportunity to perceive more accented.
In more parts of the world exist many mysteries not resolved, with presence of testimonies, so-called O.O.P.ART. (Out Of Place Artifacts) and other signals left by some entities U.F.O..
The scientists of the different disciplines, to resolve such mysteries, should collaborate for formulating hypothesis that
can initially seem eccentric.
This game is a trip among the O.O.P.ART. and in the mental faculties, to still formulate a fantastic hypothesis of solutions to the many mysteries not resolved . The Crop-Circles still represent the last signals not deciphered of possible keys of reading.
You are men with particular mental powers, you must travel using airplane in the world sites where you have been found some Crop-Circles, to find Artifacts Fragments, to recompose them to earn Mental Energy, to discover its key of reading to accumulate Points Knowledge before the " the space entity " realizes that you absorbing the equilibrium of the cosmic energies from them create. With the discovery of the "third key of the Knowledge" who has more Knowledge Points won.

2) GAME TURN:
The first player performs turn completely, then the turn passes to the player to its left, and so on clockwise.
A) Changes Objective card (Optional)
If you want you can change your Objective card choosing another from the deck (put the old card back in the deck)
B) USE AIRPLANE (Obligatory):
You must stay or to fly with your airplane, above another Archeological site, and the UFO will create a Crop-Circle card to communicate.

C) ARTIFACTS FRAGMENTS (o.o.p.art.):
You must take in your hand, all Artifacts Fragment cards of the Archaeological Site, and to place all those possible as follows:

On your Individual Board you can place or to exchange, respecting the image, the form and the color of the edge, one or more Artifacts Fragments (see Individual Board). If you complete a Artifact of one color (2 fitting Fragments in form image and color of the edge as a puzzle), you earn Mental Energy advancing with the Crystal of the same color of the edge of the recomposed Artifact.




(In a same turn you can complete maximum 2 Artifacts on your Individual Board, 1 for each color of the cards edge ).

The Artifacts Fragments that you don't place on your Individual Board, but that can complete with a second Fragment one Artifact on any Individual Board of another player, must place on his Individual Board to complete it, beginning from the player to your left. In this case the Mental




Energy earned for the completion of the Artifact, you earn you on your Individual Board, advancing with the Crystal of the same color of the edge of the completed Artifact.

For every Artifact completed with the Fragments on your Individual Board, discards from the game the couples of Artifacts Fragments, and take the Artifact Tokens corresponding to the Fragments (same image and color of the edge) from the general reserve, and place them face up into 4 spaces for every color, to the right on your Individual Board. For the Artifact completed with the Fragments on the Individual Board of the adversaries, the corresponding Artifact Token to earn adversary.




If one player has the 4 spaces for the Artifact Tokens already full , the Artifact in more must leave on the Archaeological Site.

You can also Take a possible Artifact Token left on Archaeological Site.

207850.name: The Golden Horde
207850.description:
User Summary

A real time strategy game in which you are able to guide the Mongol Hordes over the 13th century after the death of Genghis Khan. There are fourteen missions to play but also it provides custom battles over LAN.

207851.name: CreaCity
207851.description:
INTRODUCTION TO THE GAME
A stormy period of the election to the City Council has just finished. The current model of managing cities has been hugely criticized. Many of the changes that took place in Poland and in the world resulted in the search for new ways of dealing with the problem.

The project CreaCity takes place in a number of big and small places scattered all over the world. Your city has become one of the par ticipants of this great plan aimed at fixing the world.

The project assumes forming a Small Council for one term of office, which will deal with critical issues and those demanding immediate action. Your task will be to take decisions which satisfy the residents and indicate the direction of the development of the city, and at the same time avoid bringing it to bankruptcy.

This experiment may reveal new future leaders, so, even if you do not succeed, this game might be the beginning of something fantastic, both for you and the entire world.

CreaCity is a live action board game, during which players take on the role of councillors during the meetings of the Small City Council.

Each player will receive their character card stating their objectives and the committee they belong to. Each round of the game means very intense 45 minutes, during which committee members will be entrusted with Small and Big Challenges. It is these Challenges that CreaCity will be based on and, depending on the decisions taken by the players, the situation in the city will be changing.

The city is symbolized by a map divided into 8 regions. There are two dice placed in each region: a satisfaction dice (blue) and a dissatisfaction one (red).

Every time players take a binding decision, its effects will be transferred onto the board – satisfaction in the region will change (by changing the values on the dice), general satisfaction in the city and the available budget will change as well, and special buildings will appear.

Players start with a high degree of social trust and their decisions are aimed at gaining the largest general satisfaction possible. Af ter 5 rounds the game ends and the players check who accomplished the greatest number of objectives. Depending on the condition of the city, the entire Small Council receives appropriate number of victory points

GAME OBJECTIVES
For a period of 5 rounds you must not let the city go bankrupt. It happens when:

on the board, there will be 5 region bankruptcy tags.
The Dissatisfaction Tag will cross field number 30.




What is more, fight for your personal result and accomplish your objectives.

207852.description:
When you leave the airship for treasure and the captain succeeds in the next leg of the voyage you may shoot your grappling hook and get back on board. Obviously playing this special card means you'll have to leave the treasure from the previous city behind. You can't hang on to a rope without letting go of your heavy loadd.

Grappling hook:
Can be played by: a passenger who just left the ship
Can be played when: the captain announces that the journey will continue
Has for effect: that the passenger who plays this card may climb back on board of the air ship (whilst leaving the last claimed treasure behind)
207852.name: Celestia: Grappling Hook Promo

207853.name: Crozzit
207853.description:
Similar to Hex, the players race to connect two opposite sides of the board. Each player has 30 small pieces, 1 long piece and 1 extralong piece.

Pieces can be stacked creating bridges, but cannot cross over an opponent piece.

207854.name: The Legend of the Prophet and the Assassin
207854.description:
User Summary:
An adventure game based on fictional characters created by Paolo Coelho.Full of exotic figures, fantasy and interesting puzzles. A journey to the land of magic.

207855.name: Koth: Chronicles of War
207855.description:
Koth is a two-player, fantasy-themed duel card game in which players assume the roles of the two attendents (Sina or Ames) of the god of war; Koth of the game world, to decide the outcome of a battle between Orcs and Humans.

The game consists of a single deck of 52 cards. It is shared by both players to draw cards. There are 20 different kinds of units in the deck and these units are commanded onto the battlefield. Each unit has an ATTACK and a DEFENSE value. These values are used to dominate (attack) and hold (defend) a column. Some units also have ABILITIES (band, flank, rage, rally, and support) which give units additional skills than these two.

The battlefield is divided into five sections. Each section is called a "column" and players compete to dominate those columns. To dominate a column a unit's ATTACK must be at least equal to the unit's DEFENSE that is holding it.

Players have 10 Command Points (CP) for each round and they can command as many units as they please -provided they don't go over CP. Each unit has a CP cost equal to its ATTACK value.

Players start the game with three cards and draw one card at the start of their turns, and they take turns to command units onto the battlefield.

To win a game, one player must either control all of the five columns. In cases which this is not possible (i.e. when there's no more cards to draw and/or play) the player holding the most columns win the game. And whenever a player wins two consecutive games s/he wins the battle.

207856.name: CypherCaster Magazine (Issue 007 - Aug 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Tanshen’s Guide to Zuomeng: The Southeast Region in the Realm of Lan
We Want You! to Join the Sector Agents
207856.description:
From publisher blurb:

The seventh issue of the CypherCaster Magazine includes:

MCG Product Preview - Summer 2016, Check out the Torment Tides of Numenera Explorer's Guide
An in-depth interview with Monte Cook about the exciting new RPG project, Invisible Sun
The latest Streets of Qi, by Chris Fitzgerald, shares what's in Ezkros Tower
An addition to Andrew Montgomery-Hurrell's third party Numenera sourcebook, Rusthaven- The Ridden
A Numenera adventure from CypherCaster first-timer Skjalg Kreutzer of Norway called Dawn of the Black City
A short Sector Agents article that talks more about the Sector Agents themselves and shares some notable NPCs.
The Estate Dossier: Mecha World is a new batch of show 'ems for The Strange by Marc Plourde.
Tanshen’s Guide to Zuomeng: The Southeast Region in the Realm of Lan is setting material for Zuomeng, by Rustin Coones, Scott Robinson, & Jennifer Ross.
Some photos from the recent Gen Con, highlighting some of the CypherCaster crew and MCG booth and game room!

207857.name: Alien Flame
207857.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Adventure Suitable for Characters with 6-10 Current Resources.

The galaxy is becoming less mysterious every day. Corporation scientists are unravelling the secrets of the worlds while the Palantor unlock incredible new technologies. It has become rare to encounter something that science simply cannot explain - yet the Twi-Far have. The Faren, strange beings of pure energy, make up one half of the Twi-Far pairing, but no one really knows where they came from or what they are doing here.

When the Twi-Far research vessel, “The Flame” unexpectedly veers off course and heads directly for pirate territory, the scientist Elidrav fears the worst. It will take a swift and cunning team to track down “The Flame” and bring it back before the pirates snatch it away. But what exactly were the scientists aboard “The Flame” researching, and why did it so suddenly change course?

Solving these mysteries will put the PCs face-to-face with deadly secrets, fierce pirates, and innumerable twists and turns. Will the PCs prevail, or will their actions put the entire Twi-Far race at risk?

207858.name: Fragged Empire: Protagonist Archive
207858.description:
From publisher blurb:

A compendium of new Races, Factions, Locations and NPCsfor your Players to connect with.

The Fragged Empire: Protagonist Archive explores the consequences of the arrival of four new races in the Haven system. The digital Palantor, spiritual Remnant, nomadic Twi-Far and the dangerous Zhou.

Including factions, locations and a large number of new Traits and equipment.

4 new Playable Races.
8+ Factions.
6+ Locations.
155+ Traits.
90+ Weapons, Outfits & Variations.

207859.name: Staff: the Weapon of Wizards
207859.description:
From publisher blurb:

Upgrade Your Wizard's Staff!

Staff: the Weapon of Wizards introduces a new weapon for Pathfinder - the longstaff, a staff based on the historical medieval quarterstaff. According to the writings of the Renaissance arms masters, the quarterstaff was a weapon seven to eight feet long, wielded similarly to a spear or other pole weapon. The masters praise the usefulness of the staff as a weapon.

Beyond introducing the longstaff, Staff adds 11 new feats and a new druid spell.

207860.name: Magus Spells I (PRD)
207860.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level magus spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207861.name: Magus Spells I (3PP)
207861.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level magus spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

207862.name: Magus Spells II (3PP)
207862.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 2nd-level magus spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

207863.name: Magus Spells II (PRD)
207863.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 2nd-level magus spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207864.name: Magus Spells III (PRD)
207864.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 3rd-level magus spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207865.name: Magus Spells III (3PP)
207865.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 3rd-level magus spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

207866.name: A Great Upheaval
207866.description:
From the introduction:

This Chapter is designed to advance a party of 1st-level characters to 5th level. The characters gain levels by accomplishing various goals, which are summarized in the Character Advancement sidebar at the end of the chapter. If the characters are already 5th level, skip ahead to chapter 2, “Rumblings,” using the information in appendix A if the characters are transitioning from another published adventure to this one.

207867.description:
A new, official, Ancient One card, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event held on 14-15 October 2016.

Consists of a new version of Hastur, that has been created exclusively for Arkham Nights.
207867.name: Elder Sign: Arkham Nights 2016 Promotional Ancient One Card

207868.name: The Knight's House
207868.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Knight's House is a five storey Tower protected by a small wall. It's the perfect location for a base of operations, or somewhere to rest between adventures.

The Knight's House is a set of printable dungeon floorplans compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

The Knight's House is a multiple level set, comprising 5 battlemaps (each depicting a different floor)

Ground Floor (20x20) - The ground floor of the tower is surrounded by a small courtyard with stables and a jousting list, with a strong wall. The ground floor houses a large kitchen and store.
First Floor (12x10) - This floor holds the Great Hall, where the Knight greets visitors.
Second Floor (12x10) - An armoury and combat training arena.
Third Floor (12x10) - The knight's solar, with bed, garderobe, dining area, small study and chapel
Fourth Floor (12x10) - An attic bedroom for squires and men-at-arms.




The Knight's House is part of the Tower Builder range. You can put the floors in any order, or add in floors from other maps in the Tower Builder range to make custom towers.
Each Tower is associated with a different class or character type, making them perfect as a base for your character.

207869.name: The Ranger's House
207869.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ranger's House is a five storey Tower located in the forest. It's the perfect location for a base of operations, or somewhere to rest between adventures.

The Ranger's House is a set of printable dungeon floorplans compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

The Ranger's House is a multiple level set, comprising 5 battlemaps (each depicting a different floor)

Ground Floor (20x20) - The ground floor of the tower is located in a forest. Outside the tower are wolf skins and a smoking hut for meat, and the ground floor of the tower houses animal pens.
First Floor (12x10) - A messy kitchen with large table and various items, including a messy bed.
Second Floor (12x10) - An armoury, workshop and store room.
Third Floor (12x10) - A study and library with display cabinets, bookshelves and desks.
Fourth Floor (12x10) - An attic bedroom.




The Ranger's House is part of the Tower Builder range. You can put the floors in any order, or add in floors from other maps in the Tower Builder range to make custom towers.
Each Tower is associated with a different class or character type, making them perfect as a base for your character.

207870.name: deadEarth Getting Started Guide
207870.description:
From the introduction:

The best way to learn how to play deadEarth, believe it or not, is to play it - not read it.

User summary:

This somewhat whimsical quick-start guide consists primarily of open license (legalese) text. Actual quick-start information is limited to a one-page session transcript and some basic encouragement.

207871.name: Jeu de mots
207871.description:
Jeu de mots is is a French game. With the help of the letters in your hand, you must try to complete a word that contains the strike of letters appearing at the center of the gaming table. The more your word is long, the more you score.
It's similar to Scrabble, but with a dice and with cards, without game board.

207872.name: Heavenly Battle
207872.description:
User Summary

An arcade style game, you shoot approaching aircraft, earning points for staying alive. Those points can be used to upgrade your aircraft.

207873.name: Ian's Eyes
207873.description:
User Summary

You play as North, Ian’s lifelong canine companion.

207874.name: Featherpunk Prime
207874.description:
Blast, boost, slide and shoot your way past hordes of Avian Warbots as a super-agile Cyber-Flamingo! Featherpunk Prime is a twin-stick shooter-platformer with tight, responsive controls, an array of powerful weaponry and upgradable abilities. Ascend the tower, take down Cybirdroid and free the Flamingos!

Source: The Developer Website.

207875.name: Zero G (Issue 1 - May 2015)
207875.description:
From publisher's blurb:

First Fanzine for the game Space Cadet Alpha. In this issue the Story of the earth refugee Vegas continues as he get to his first duty assignment.

More background on the society of the races and starter spaceship building design rules.

207876.name: Pozzo Jello Crusade
207876.description:
POZZO JELLO CRUSADE is the highly anticipated remake to the gruelling 2005 breakout hit. The unique old-school puzzle experience captivated imaginations of gamers worldwide with incredible challenge and intense emotional reward.

Source: The Developer Website.

207877.name: Fall of Civilization
207877.description:
User Summary

You play as a survivor of the end of the world, creating your own story, controlling a faction of people you choose how you live.

207878.name: Zero G (Issue 2 - Aug 2015)
207878.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Continuing the story of Vegas on his first duty. Cybernetic arm rules, Space station classification rules. Bak ground on artificial robots and two robots to use against your players.

More background on the society of the races.

207883.description:
Overwhelmed by the stress of the hooligan hootenanny that's overrunning the bustling town of Bandit Bluff, the resident deputy has up and left his post! Sheriff Croc Holliday is shuffling and hustling to find his next deputy. Looking to fill the vacancy, Croc has decided to put a pool of new recruits to work helping clean up some of Bandit Bluff's most wanted outlaws and will choose the most dedicated to be the new deputy! A little lying, some stealthy scheming, and the sense to know a good time to tell the truth might just help give a leg up over the rest of the herd. Who will out-law the other applicants to become the new deputy?

OutLawed! is a social game of bluffing, truth-telling, and out-thinking your opponents. Each player has an identical set of eleven outlaw cards imagined as animals escaped from the zoo somewhere in the wild, wild west. Over a series of rounds, players take turns playing a card face down and making a claim about which character card they played. Players are free to tell the truth about the character played or to make a bold-faced lie! After players have played cards and made their claims, all the characters are revealed and each player assesses whether or not they have met their outlaw's "apprehend if" condition. Players who were successful add their outlaws to their jail pile while all other players place the card back in their hand. Lionel Manesworth, for example, can be captured only if you tell the truth. The Vixen Twins get nabbed when others are convinced to play the same card during the round. Lawman Croc Holliday will catch anybody who isn't on the up and up.

Once a player fills up their jail, everyone compares their total reward value of apprehended cards to see who has earned the most rewards and gets to fill the vacant position as deputy of Bandit Bluff.
207883.name: OutLawed!
boardgamepodcastepisode: #42: A Trip to Asheville, Herbaceous on Tap, Well Played games cafe, Dream Home, OutLawed, Heroes & Tricks and lots more
The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 66: Thursday, September 15th

207884.name: MasterChef Junior
207884.description:
The official board game of MasterChef Junior TV Show.
You can play the kids or the family version.
KIDS
Play 5 challenges with the ingredient cards and tiles: the challenges are based on pattern recognition, fast catch, memory and deductive skills.
FAMILY
Create a dish using some ingredient cards drawn from the deck.
The players vote the best and the more original dish, and score points accordingly.

The player with the most points will win and can wear the chef hat!

207885.name: Shooty Space
207885.description:
User Summary

A standard shoot em' up.

207886.name: Brain Flip
207886.description:
Give the wrong answer on purpose! In Brain Flip, one player picks a card and the other players try to guess which card it is by asking questions. The twist: every answer given will be the opposite of the truth. Train your brain to do mind bending gymnastics and you will be the winner!

Display a number of cards on the table. Mentally pick one and prepare to answer the players’ questions. The players will try to guess the card you picked by asking questions that have to be answer only by YES or NO. You must always answer the opposite. It looks simple, but it will trick their brains. Don’t get confuse!
Play smart and find the hidden card! Tally the points to see who is the Winner!

207887.name: Tiki Man
207887.description:
User Summary

This si a Timber Man knock-off: using two buttons, choose sides of a 'tiki' pole to chop during a time limit. Bonus figures given for high one-time score or overall score.

207888.name: Flotti Karotti
207888.description:
In Flotti Karotti, the orange carrot Karotti sits in the (plastic) green hill and plays music. The young players hop about like rabbits until they hear a command from Karroti, e.g., "Seek my friend Bruno Broccoli!" at which point the children race to find Bruno Broccoli amongst the face-down tiles. Players also need fast reactions as sometimes Karotti will rocket into the air, rewarding whoever grabs it first.

In the end, whoever collects the most carrot chips wins!

207889.name: Magus Spells IV (PRD)
207889.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 4th-level magus spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207890.name: Magus Spells IV (3PP)
207890.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 4th-level magus spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

207891.name: Magus Spells V (3PP)
207891.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 5th-level magus spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

207892.name: KoonKan
207892.description:
This card game is played with a 61-card deck. The deck has four suits (Star, Flag, Cross and Seal) each with cards numbered 1-15, along with a Koon card bearing the picture of a raccoon.

Players are dealt 10 cards each to start. On each turn, a player draws a card from the top of the remaining deck or of the discard pile, plays a set or more if he wishes, and discards a card. As in rummy, sets can be three or more of a kind or three or more of a suit in sequence.

However, in addition to laying down sets of their own, players may add cards to any set or sequence of any player on the board. The Koon card is wild and may be used in any set, but if it is played on the end of a sequence, the player holding that actual card may play it, and add the Koon to the other end of the sequence.

The object is to be the first player to empty his hand. The last card in a hand may be discarded or may be used in a set, with no discard. Other players add up the value of cards remaining in their hand and score that many points. Game winner is the one with the fewest points at the end of the agreed number of hands.

207893.name: Magus Spells V (PRD)
207893.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 5th-level magus spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207894.name: Magus Spells VI (PRD)
207894.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 6th-level magus spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207895.name: Magus Spells VI (3PP)
207895.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 6th-level magus spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

207896.name: Jeu du Juif-Errant
207896.description:
This mid-19th Century game is laid out like Game of Goose, with an inward spiral of 63 spaces, but it is based on the 1844 novel Le Juif-Errant (The Wandering Jew), by Eugene Sue. The starting (lower-left) corner of the board has an impage of Sue at work writing the novel. The other corners and each space on the track show a character or incident from the 1400-page book. The center of the board shows the Wandering Jew arriving in Paris, and also includes the rules.

As in Game of Goose, players make an initial ante, and may be forced to pay more into the pot as a result of landing on certain squares. The first player to reach the end of the track takes the pot.

207897.description:
Place the Scuffle board on the left side of the Port boards.
Before visiting the Port buildings, each player rolls 1 of their Ship dice and places it near the Scuffle board.
Starting from the Baron and going clockwise, each player chooses one die and takes from the bag the Loot shown on the matching space of the Scuffle Board.
Ship die goes back to the owner and then next player chooses another one- until all of the dice have been resolved.
207897.name: Rattle, Battle, Grab The Loot: Port Scuffle

207898.name: Captive
207898.description:
Why would someone attack a policeman? It's one of many questions you've been obsessing about since you received this ransom demand following your daughter's kidnapping.

As you begin walking toward the front door of a manor house deep in the woods in Captive, your hand cramping above your weapon, your spirit satiated with fear, you anticipate that things will turn out badly. Your intuition will not betray you — even if you were far from imagining what was actually in reserve for you on the most horrifying evening of your entire existence.

Captive is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

207899.name: Knights
207899.description:
In the year of grace 1012 in the lands of the good King Louilepou, three brothers dream of belonging to the order of the knights of the monarchy, knights without fear and without reproach who are capable of traveling crazy distances, of killing the most dangerous of thieves, and of defending brave peasants. One of these three brothers is you, but the road to becoming a knight is extremely long!

In Knights, you have to travel the vast royal lands — crossing snowy mountains, haunted lakes, and dark forests — in search of bracelets of bravery. You might find yourself face to face with a troll, an old wizard, or a warrior, and you must solve riddles to discover hidden compartments, to learn fighting techniques, and to collect magic items. Your success depends on your choices because you are the hero!

Knights is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

207900.description:
An unusual structure has emerged on the mountainside that one would think to be desolate: a long-lost temple fort of Artheastam, the Kingdom of Light — or is it rather a slaughterhouse? Several adventurers have been brave enough to attempt to discover the secret of the temple, yet none returned to tell the tale. What could this secret be? Why do so many go about risking their lives? Are they aware of what lies ahead of them?

The Kingdom of Artheastam has come to the decision to send its three most excellent warriors to face the peril. This will surely not be watched from the sideline by either the offsprings of darkness or the Mountaindeep or by the dispersed spacebenders. The future of their world is at stake, and they want to get hold of their legacy.

In Magitics, a team of heroes controlled by a player must confront the other players' heroes in a diverse arena. Their aim is to be the winner of this fight and get a piece of a crystal that involves magical powers, hidden by Sethemet, the space-time magician.

In this conflict, all players control separate hero troops. During these battles, they may get spells, magic items and valuable loot, which strengthen them. They may receive different benefits, too. Players choose heroes that they want to activate; these heroes can perform various actions up to their available action points. The players' goal is to ensure that with the right tactical decisions their resourceful heroes prove to be stronger than others or completely overcome their opponents by the end of the round. If all players activated their heroes, a new round begins.
207900.name: Magitics

207901.description: Contains 20 cards to swap with specific cards from The Wastes of Eriador Adventure pack encounter deck to raise the difficulty of that scenario to nightmare difficulty.
207901.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Wastes of Eriador Nightmare Deck
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

207902.description:
Galactic Coliseum is a fast-paced game where cunning tactics and strategy are utilized with a combination of unique game mechanics, gorgeous illustrations, and detailed science-fantasy miniatures. Playable for 2-4 players in Versus and Team Battle modes, you will suit up as high-tech Gladiators, each with your own skills and powers. Get ready to cut your way through 4 stages of flesh and steel as you advance through an ever-expanding gauntlet of massive mechanical monsters.

Let the games begin.
207902.name: Galactic Coliseum

207903.description: Contains 20 cards to swap with specific cards from the Escape From Mount Gram Adventure pack encounter deck to raise the difficulty of that scenario to nightmare difficulty.
207903.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Escape From Mount Gram Nightmare Deck
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

207904.description: Contains 20 cards to swap with specific cards from the Across the Ettenmoors Adventure pack encounter deck to raise the difficulty of that scenario to nightmare difficulty.
207904.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Across the Ettenmoors Nightmare Deck
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

207905.name: Magic: The Gathering – Duel Decks: Speed vs. Cunning
207905.description:
From the publisher's website:

Shrieking Hordes Confront Tactical Masters Racing across the blazing steppe, the wave of attackers crests the barren hills. Nothing can stop their reckless advance. These warriors live fast, fight hard, and strike terror into the hearts of those in their path. The scarred countryside seems abandoned. Then, suddenly, hidden fighters spring from ambush. The overconfident enemy recoils in surprise, outflanked and outsmarted. Who will prevail, the swift or the sly?

These ready-to-play decks showcase cards from across Magic history, including six cards from the new Khans of Tarkir ™ set and four cards with new artwork.

207906.name: Sushi Go!
207906.description:
Sushi Go! is a digital adaptation of the popular card game of the same name. Players compete for the highest score, by picking sushi from a conveyor belt, and scoring the sushi they took at the end of each round. Each type of sushi earns points in different ways, and players must max their combos and prevent opponents from doing the same.

Play a pair of Tempuras for 5 points, but play one on its own and you'll get none! Nigiris can be dipped in Wasabi to triple their points! Pudding doesn't score until the end of the game, but it can clinch a victory or cause a defeat!

Sushi Go is simple enough to play with the family, but thousands of sushi combinations will keep even diehard strategy fans playing. Do you take a Tempura to get points for a pair? Or take Sashimi to stop your opponent from completing his triplet? Pudding doesn't earn points in the round, but you'll lose points at the end of the game if you have the fewest!

Sushi Go (the card game) was created by Phil Walker-Harding, and published by Gamewright.

Source: The Developer Website.

207910.name: Subatomic: An Atom Building Game
207910.description: Subatomic is a deck building game where players are competing to build a number of available atoms. Each player starts with the same small deck of cards that consist of Proton Cards, Neutron Cards, Electron Cards and Energy Cards and a beginning hand limit of 5 cards. They use these cards to build upon their current Atom, in an attempt to construct one of the available Atom Cards, and/or use their hand of cards to purchase more powerful atom building cards for later use, or increase their hand limit. The deck building cards are simple and clean, but offer a number of interesting combinations. Players also have an energy track that allows them to store energy, which introduces a "push-their-luck" type of mechanic enabling players to pay energy to shuffle through their deck quicker, or to offset the cost of more powerful deck building cards.

207911.name: Trivial Pursuit: 2000s Edition
207911.description:
New edition of the classic trivia game this time testing your knowledge of the 2000s.

Features some new gameplay including seeing the topic of a question and choosing to new "stump your opponents" if you think they can't answer a question based on that topic or if you're not confident of your abilities in that topic.

207912.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 199 - Sep 2016)
207912.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 199
September 2016

Malifaux: Ripples of Fate

207913.name: Visitors
207913.description:
When you buy a country farm you should be ready for anything, even an alien invasion. A house far from civilization is all our hero has ever dreamed of, and it just so happens that a juicy offer has presented itself.

Source: The Developer Website.

207915.description:
A board game based on the reality show "L'isola dei famosi" (Survivor in English).
There are 12 castaways, independently of the number of players. Each player receives secretly a card with 6 castaways they have to keep on the island.
Each round players challenge to be the group leader. There are different kinds of challenge: dexterity, acting, memory, trivia, words, calculation, deduction.
The winner receives food, chooses which castaway will be immune and votes the castaway he wants to eliminate. Then, the other players vote the castaway they want to eliminate.
There is a runoff voting between the 2 selected castaways: after it one castaway is eliminated.
After the last round the castaways are ranked according to their position (from 1 to 12) and players score points accordingly.
The player with the most point is the winner.
207915.name: L'isola dei famosi

207916.name: Il nuovo gioco dell'oca + La lepre e la tartaruga
207916.description:
A box with 2 games:
1) Il nuovo gioco dell'oca
A mix between The game of goose and Ludo. Each player tries to move his 3 geese to the end of path (2 adult and 1 child): during his turn he rolls the die and moves one goose. According to the square he lands, he can move forward, backward, roll again or move back an opponent goose to closer lake. If 2 or 3 geese of the same player are on the same square, they are safe. An adult can "eat" an opponent child, a child can't "eat" an opponent adult.

2) La lepre e la tartaruga
A racing game for 2 players, based on the Aesop's tail "The hare and the tortoise".
Each player rolls the die and moves his figure, then he can put a tile on the path and/or move again if he lands to a tile or a square with a number. Each tile has a number between 1 and 3, with + or -: so a player will move forward or backward 1-3 squares.
The game ends after one player completes 2 rounds.

207917.name: Scandinavia and the World: A Heap of Trouble
207917.description:
The world is populated country spirits that embody the loves, hates and secret wishes of the nations that they represent. Unfortunately all of their stuff has become tangled into a giant heap. Now Scotland is fighting America over who needs that declaration of independence more, Russia is eyeing North Pole's oil and nobody will admit to having Denmark's pornography.

It's down to you to sort it out.

Scandinavia and the World: A Heap of Trouble is a lighthearted bidding game for 2-5 players. Each turn players gain cards that they can use them as coins to bid for the favour (and special abilities) of countries that they like or as objects to satisfy countries who are already working with them. The first player to have three satisfied countries supporting them is the winner.

207918.name: The Legend of Sabao
207918.description:
The Legend of Sabao is the first game of a business game series based on the history of the Tang Danasty. Sabao is the leader of a merchant caravan, and the story of this game is based on a Buddhist fable.

Through the mechanisms of worker placement and area control, players travel into the world of one thousand years ago to act as a Sabao and gain as much profit as possible while undergoing a long and dangerous journey. You have to balance the resources you have, and sometimes make tough calls, perhaps even sacrificing to maintain the best for the caravan and gain the most profit.

•••

《萨薄传奇》是预计的大唐商人系列里的第一部，游戏类型是区域控制+工人放置，玩家人数2-6人。游戏的题材来源于历史上唐人对商主的称谓和一个萨薄燃臂引路的佛教故事。
萨薄（bao2声）在古代的商人里，代表的不单是关于经商，更是一种可靠的担当。玩家在游戏里扮演一只商队的首领，带着自己的伙计，游走与长城内外，和其他玩家去竞争这样一个在大唐商人眼里非比寻常的地位。
要成为被尊称为萨薄的商主，就要比一般的商人要更加严格地维护整个商队的利益，带领他们度过难关寻找商机，甚至有时候必须做出牺牲取舍，来完成目标。

207919.description:
In Hounded, players will either be the cunning fox, trying to elude capture, or the determined hunter, trying to hunt down the fox.

In the game. each player moves their pawns and turns over tiles as they do, sometimes triggering effects and sometimes not. While the fox character is alone, the hunter has a team of hounds to help him hunt the fox. All the hunter has to do to win is either corner the fox with his dogs or force the fox to end his turn next to the hunter himself. For the fox to win, it has to run out the clock, which is done by either finding the three timepiece tiles or flipping over 43 of the 49 tiles. Once time runs out, the hunter has to retire for the day and the fox escapes!
207919.name: Hounded

207920.name: SupraRAM 2000
207920.description:
User Summary
Memory expansion for the desktop Amigas (Amiga 2000, Amiga 3000, Amiga 4000) fitting the ZorroII slots.

The card was preinstalled with 2 MB RAM but could be expanded to 4 MB, 6 MB or 8 MB by adding more groups of 16 1Mx1 (511000) DIPs (70-120ns).
A fully loaded board of 8 MB would require a total og 64 DIPs.

Board was fitted with a jumper for enable/disable.

Manual
Adding RAM to the SupraRAM 2000 Board (Optional)
The SupraRAM 2000 can be purchased with 2, 4, 6, or 8MB of RAM
already installed. If your SupraRAM 2000 contains 2, 4, or 6MB of
RAM, you can add more RAM (in 2MB blocks), when it's convenient
for your needs or budget

207921.name: Magus Spells (3PP)
207921.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

207922.name: Magus Spells (PRD)
207922.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Magus Spells is a simple document that collects the magus spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

207923.name: The Little Book Of Dungeons Volume IV
207923.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within this particular volume of The Little Book of Dungeons you will find six colour maps that have been drawn in a different art style than those of the previous three booklets (as can be seen in the preview).

Furthermore, as well as being able to use these maps individually (to represent modest size dungeons and cave systems), you can also piece several (or indeed all) of them together to create much larger areas for your players to explore!

Note that unlabelled image files have also been supplied (scaled at 70 pixels per grid square) for use with virtual tabletops.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
207924.name: Villains of the Undercity
207924.description:
From publisher blurb:

Danger lurks at every corner of the small coastal city of Los Farport. The locals insist people are being abducted in the night and taken into into the bowels of the rumored “Undercity Dungeon” below. A lone survivor managed to escape and give some information before dying in your arms: “Secret door... Tavern of the Wiley Wench... Ugh!” You and your brave team of adventurers have decided to investigate these rumors, plunder the dungeon and destroy the dreaded “Villains of the Undercity!” ...right after you loot his still warm body, of course.

36 page module
3 blue dungeon maps (two dungeon levels and one tavern map)
8 Pre-Generated Characters
Awesome old school fun

207925.name: Keep Your Friends Close
207925.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs are part of a diplomatic crew in the service of Pappa Doc’s railways. A particularly crucial train is coming through the mountain bottleneck of Tiger Valley to dock with an oil refinery. The whole railway is desperately short on oil, due to mounting attacks from NORAD-affiliated groups, and this train only has enough diesel to get through this route — having to go back would mean adding on an extra five hundred kilometres to their journey.

But something's not quite right in Tiger Valley. Though they're friendly enough, a tension lies just beneath the surface. Is this just due to recent bandit attacks, or is some other game afoot? The PCs will need to keep their wits about them, and their ears to the ground if they hope to get out of the valley in one piece - or at all.

A one-shot scenario for Infected Zombie RPG, for 1-6 players, and estimated to take 4-6 hours.

207926.name: 100 Items to Find in an Occultist's Chambers
207926.description:
This is a list of 100 different occult-related that players might find in rooms belonging to an occultist. The items are suitable for most settings where such may be encountered.

The items cover various different types. There is a distinct edge towards modern paganism and Wicca practices, as these most commonly use items, but there are some from other traditions too. These are all genuine types of occult and pagan items. Whether or not the items listed have any in-game value other than decorative is up to the GameMaster.

Each entry has the item, and may have additional details on them too, which can result in many more items than the 100 listed. They can be used as decorative items should the players be rummaging through the possessions of a suitable NPC.

Some examples are:

9. Bags (Drawstring bags, different materials, velvet, leather, cotton, silk, satin or plastic)
10. Bath Supplies (Ritual bathing and cleansing salts, oils, soaps and lotions)
11. Bell (Small, hand held)

- Publisher's description

207927.name: 100 Detailed Items to Find in an Occultist's Chambers
207927.description:
This is a list primarily suited for the 19th century or later. There are 100 different items on the list, each of which is a detailed description of an item that could be found in the possession of an occultist or pagan.

The items are most suited for hermetic or pagan practitioners, with a strong Celtic influence, although there are some other traditions.

An example result:

42. Gemstone - A piece of black obsidian around 2" long and 1/4" wide with a hexagonal cross-section and two points.

- Publisher's description

207928.name: The House on the Hill
207928.description:
From the introduction:

After talking with Revol [the party] decides to go to the Taskmasters Guild to see if they have any work for hire. [But first the party] decides to stop at the Erotic Goat; they could really do with a break.

207929.name: 100 Things to Find by the Side of the Road
207929.description:
This modern list covers 100 different things that can be found by the side of the road, with some possible variations.

Items may be useful, or simply junk. They could be found by players during the course of a regular adventure, or could be scavenged after an apocalypse.

Some example results are:

41. Furniture (Such as sofas and chairs, probably water damaged, may have vermin)
42. Garbage Bags (Tied rubbish bags full of dumped waste)
43. Glass (Broken pieces of glass, such as windscreen safety glass, or from a light cluster, which is probably plastic)

- Publisher's description

207930.name: 100 Things to Find in a Survivalist's Retreat
207930.description:
This is a list of 100 items that may be found in a survivalist's retreat, whether this be an extensive construction out in the wilds or a simple bunker or room in an urban setting. Although there are 100 items on the list, many of these can then be split into further items.

Survivalists don't just have guns; they also have other things needed to survive, such as food, supplies, hunting equipment, tools and power sources. These can be useful for any players in any post-apocalyptic setting, whether this be a zombie apocalypse or a traditional nuclear war. they aren't solely of use in those settings either, as they could also be used if the players are investigating or infiltrating a survivalist or survivalist organisation before the end of the world.

61. Maps (Of the local area, including navigation equipment such as compasses)
62. Matches (Strike anywhere, kept dry)
63. Meat Grinder (For mincing raw meat)

- Publisher's description

207931.name: 100 More Things to Find in a Survivalist's Retreat
207931.description:
This is a list of another 100 items that may be found in a survivalist's retreat, whether this be an extensive construction out in the wilds or a simple bunker or room in an urban setting. Although there are 100 items on the list, many of these can then be split into further items.

Survivalists don't just have guns; they also have other things needed to survive, such as food, supplies, hunting equipment, tools and power sources. These can be useful for any players in any post-apocalyptic setting, whether this be a zombie apocalypse or a traditional nuclear war. they aren't solely of use in those settings either, as they could also be used if the players are investigating or infiltrating a survivalist or survivalist organisation before the end of the world.

80. Solar Lights (Probably for external use)
81. Spikes (For fixing ropes and cords to)
82. Spinning Wheel (For making yarn from pet and animal hair)

- Publisher's description

207932.description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 1 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, Klingon Civil War. It is a Vor'Cha Class ship.
207932.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Bor'tas Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

207933.description:
The Fleet Commander Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 1, "Attack on Gowron," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Klingon Civil War.

When using the Fleet Commander resource, you may assign two captains to a single ship. That ship may use both captains' abilities as normal throughout the game. The Captain Skill Number for the ship is equal to the higher skill of the two Captains, plus 1.

Additionally, at the start of the game that ship may add 1 to either it's Shield or Hull value (but only to a maximum of 6 for Hull value).

The Fleet Commander is considered a resource and costs 5 SP.
207933.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Fleet Commander Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

207934.description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, Klingon Civil War. It is a K'Vort Class ship.
207934.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Hegh'ta Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

207935.name: Tengrave's Folly
207935.description:
From the introduction:

Milicent Tengrave led an expedition into the southern woods sixty years ago. The original purpose was to establish a settlement there, but early orc attacks doomed the settlement to failure. After first contact, the orcs became a constant threat to supply lines to Stawford. At one point, there were doubts as to if the small town would survive.

User summary:

For 4th level characters.

207936.description:
The Auxiliary Power Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 2, "Battle of Mempa," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Klingon Civil War.
